533.description: B, A’s tyrannical spouse, goes out for the evening and orders A not to leave the house while ae is away

description: B is forbidden by aer spouse, A, to engage in a certain enterprise * B engages in a certain enterprise which aer spouse, A, condemns and forbids aer taking part in
** B, engaging in an enterprise forbidden by aer spouse, A, discovers that A has a part in it

535.description: B, spouse of A, saves A-3, a supposed transgressor, from the law by a public confession of aer delinquency * A, because of aer great love for aer spouse, B, forgives aer delinquency and glories in aer moral courage in making a confession of it **

536.description: B, married to A, is about to elope with A-3 * B, spouse of A, is eloping with A-3 when they meet a stranger, A-2; and A-2, in the presence of both B and A-3, tells about a man, AX, who broke up a home by eloping with a friend’s spouse and then abandoning aer. A-2 has recognized A-3 and, in order to save B, tells this story about aer, hiding A-3’s identity under a fictitious name. But it is enough, A-3 sneaks away, and B never sees aer again **

description: A’s spouse, B, is murdered at a certain hour of the night * A is suspected of having murdered aer spouse, B; but, at the hour the murder was committed, A was with B-3

538.description: A, spouse of B, enroute to aer home in the country, is caught in a storm and is out all night * A, absent from home all night, finds on reaching home in the morning, that aer spouse, B, is missing ** A mistakenly supposes that aer spouse, B, has eloped with A-3 ***

540.description: A, spouse of B, vanishes mysteriously * A, spouse of B, and B-3, both vanish mysteriously at the same time ** Gossip has it that A, spouse of B, has eloped with B-3 ***

541.description: A, whenever ae attempts to have X, a certain object of mystery, explained to aer, meets with misfortune * A, showing X, a mysterious object of mystery, to aer spouse. B, is astounded when B, without explanation, begins divorce proceedings

542.description: A labors under the mistaken belief that the altruism of aer spouse, B, is prompted by selfish motives

543.description: B, spouse of A, is jealous of the attentions A gives aer mother, M-A * B has a mistaken idea that aer spouse’s mother, M-A, is trying to interfere between aer and A

544.description: B labors under the mistaken belief that aer spouse, A, receives all the praise for aer own kindly acts

545.description: B’s spouse, A, fails to return home. A blizzard is raging, and B fears that A has suffered misfortune in the storm * B meets aer death while searching vainly in a storm for aer spouse, A **

547.description: A dearly loves aer spouse, B; and aer love, which ae does not possess, is necessary to aer happiness

549.description: A is married to B, and aer ideal is faithfulness * A’s spouse, B, elopes with aer friend, A-2, a man more successful in business than A **

550.description: A, married to B, after a long, mysterious absence returns to find B married to A-3

551.description: A discovers that aer spouse, B, is the mother of A-2’s son, CH

553.description: A believes that aer spouse, B, is in love with A-3

554.description: A secretly discovers that aer spouse, B, has an affair with A-3

556.description: A, married to B, pretends to be single in making love to B-8 * A, spouse of B, is killed in an accident while on the way to elope with B-3 **

558.description: B, spouse of brutal and tyrannical A, has a loyal friend in A-3. A-3 seeks to help B escape from A * A, the brutal and tyrannical spouse of B, is a huge man and as powerful and determined as ae is brutal; and A-3, who would save B from A, is a coward **

559.description: B’s spouse, A, is a tyrannical, churlish person whose dislike for aer attractive spouse inspires in aer small mind a desire to persecute aer * B, spouse of brutal and tyrannical A, is loved by A-3. B, although ae loves A-3, is too high-minded to consider an elopement, or to be a party to any sort of intrigue **

560.description: A finds that a delusion regarding the apparition of aer deceased spouse, B, is entangled with truth * A hears the voice of aer deceased spouse, B, and there seems absolutely no doubt that it is aer voice **

561.description: A, spouse of B, receives anonymous communications regarding B and A-3

description: A, spouse of B, receives each morning a mysterious communication regarding B
* A finds an anonymous communication regarding aer spouse, B, on a sheet of paper in aer typewriter
** A receives through the mails, “poison pen” letters

565.description: B cherishes a dear desire that aer spouse, A, shall become religiously inclined

567.description: A’s spouse, B, is dishonored (and slain?) by A-3 * A’s spouse. B, is dishonored and slain, during the war, by an enemy officer, A-3 ** A seeks to find A-3 and be revenged on aer for a grievous wrong committed against A’s spouse, B ***

569.description: B’s spouse, A, is killed by A-5 * B’s spouse, A, is killed by A-5; and A-5, through the law’s delay and technicalities, escapes with only a light sentence ** B invokes the Mosaic law in seeking revenge upon A-5 for the murder of aer spouse, A ***

570.description: B is the daughter of A and step-daughter of A’s spouse, SM-B * B seeks revenge upon aer step-mother, SM-B, because ae thinks SM-B has stolen the affections of aer father, A, away from aer **

571.description: A, mysteriously missing, returns to aer home and aer spouse, B, in a dazed condition, unable to give any explanations

572.description: A, spouse of B, mysteriously disappears * B’s spouse, A, mysteriously disappears, and B mourns for aer as dead **

575.description: A becomes aware of the impending death of aer spouse, B

577.description: A suffers remorse and overwhelming sorrow—remorse for broken vows, and sorrow because of the death of aer dearly beloved spouse, B * A, goaded by sorrow for the death of aer spouse, B, goes into seclusion **

580.description: B is the spouse of A, a friend of A-2’s * A’s friend, A-2, discovers that A’s spouse, B, is a “vamp” **

581.description: B desires the love and consideration of aer spouse, A, which ae believes ae has lost

582.description: B, opening a letter addressed to aer spouse, A, discovers that A has lied to aer

586.description: B believes that aer spouse, A, loves aer less than ae does a certain small statue, X, that stands on aer desk

587.description: B, the deceased spouse of A, appears to a relative of A’s and describes aer mortal reactions to A’s lack of affection for aer

588.description: B, dying, reveals to aer spouse, A, a closely guarded secret which ae finds greatly perturbing

589.description: B is convinced that aer spouse, A, has eloped with B-3

590.description: B, fourth spouse of A, discovers shortly after aer marriage that A’s other wives have all died suddenly and mysteriously

591.description: B, alone, helpless and in terrible danger, sends to aer spouse, A, a despairing call for aid

592.description: B revolts against certain unpleasant conditions involving aer spouse, A

593.description: B secretly takes money from aer spouse, A, for aer own use

595.description: A exercises mistaken judgment in forwarding a certain undertaking * A loses aer initiative, aer enterprise and aer ambition, and becomes merely a cog in the wheels of aer employer **

596.description: A secures knowledge of a closely-guarded secret * A, securing knowledge of a closely-guarded secret, is hounded by a guilty persecutor, A-5, until aer life is made miserable **

597.description: A’s chauffeur, A-7, driving A’s car by A’s orders at a high rate of speed, apparently injures a pedestrian, A-8 * A, when aer car apparently injures a pedestrian, seeks to evade legal consequences by having aer chauffeur, A-7, drive on at speed **

598.description: A, an author, impersonates the crook hero of a story ae is writing for the purpose of obtaining situations and “local color” * A, a novelist, impersonates the hero of a story ae is writing and becomes involved in an unpleasant complication **

599.description: A, in order to oblige aer friend, A-2, acts contrary to aer own principles and experiences unpleasant results * A dons A-2’s mask and costume and assumes A-2’s role at a carnival, A-2 being called away suddenly on pressing business and promising to return shortly. A is against masquerades on principle and, when A-2 fails to return, ae is in a dilemma **

600.description: A, in a foreign seaport and seeking to return at night to aer steamer, loses aer way and finds aerself in the lawless slums

601.description: A, seeking to help aer friend, A-2, lends aer all aer money * A’s friend, A-2, fails to repay money borrowed from A and A is left penniless **

602.description: A, a pugilist, loses a ring battle and all the money ae has wagered on aerself

604.description: A is in the employ of A-8, a man in whom ae has implicit confidence * A, employed by A-8, comes to work one morning and finds the office in the hands of federal agents, A-6, A-6 ** A’s employer, A-8, has been “using the mails to defraud” ***

605.description: A, stricken with fever in a wilderness country, is attended by an old woman, B * A, falling ill in a wilderness country, is attended by an old woman. B, to whom years before, ae had taught a fake method of healing **

606.description: A has invested all aer money in a certain enterprise * A, investing all aer money in a certain enterprise, sees the enterprise fail and aerself plunged heavily into debt **

607.description: A and aer friend, A-2, explorers, are alone in the jungle * A’s friend, A-2, goes insane from eating the berries of a strange plant, and makes a murderous attack upon A **

description: A, in a strange part of the country, is arrested by the police as a criminal “suspect” * A, arrested by the police as a criminal “suspect”, has in aer possession a satchel, innocently come by

609.description: A, temporarily in charge of two mischievous children, CH-1 and CH-2, finds aerself in more dilemmas than ae can successfully manage

610.description: A is a fugitive from justice, hunted by A-6, an officer of the law * A is in a trap in the town of X. ae can escape only by passing through the towns of Y or Z, and detectives, A-6 and A-6, are watching for aer in both places **

612.description: A receives A-5 on a forged letter of recommendation from a friend, A-2, and introduces A-5 into aer own social circle * A, standing sponsor for A-5, discovers that A-5 is a crooked gambler who uses A’s sponsorship for the purpose of mulcting A’s friends **

613.description: A, given to altruistic enterprises, befriends a tramp, A-5 * A befriends a tramp, A-5; and A-5, taking advantage of A’s hospitality, steals valuable property from aer **

614.description: A loses a valuable diamond, X * A loses a valuable diamond, X, in a place where there is a flock of chickens, and ae insists that the chickens must be killed, one by one, until the diamond is found. The chickens are all killed ** A loses a valuable diamond, X, and has aer suspicions as to where it can be found, but discovers that aer suspicions are unfounded ***

615.description: A, a coward and a braggart, is manoeuvered into a dangerous test, and must either eat aer words or acquit aerself with credit * A, a coward who has been manoeuvered into a dangerous test of courage, is almost beside aerself with fear as ae sets forth to meet the test **

616.description: A has confided to B the combination of aer safe, X * A, confiding to B the combination of aer safe. X. brings danger to B **

617.description: A shows aer ignorance of the usages of high society by unpacking aer satchel when a servant, A-7, is expected to do it for aer * A, annoyed by a faux pas ae has committed, seeks to “save aer face” **

618.description: A is bored by certain duties ae is obliged to perform * A, bored by certain duties ae is obliged to perform, finds a way out—with unpleasant results **

619.description: A loses all aer life’s savings * A plans to take has own life, but fate intervenes **

620.description: A loses aer job * A suffers misfortune because ae departs from the strict line of duty in order to carry out a cherished ambition of aer own **

621.description: A is swindled out of aer life’s savings by A-5 * A, swindled out of aer life’s savings by A-5, is about to take aer own life when aer lost money is returned to aer by a mysterious person, AX ** AX, a mysterious “righter of wrongs,” at the point of a gun takes from A-5 money out of which A-5 has swindled A and restores the money to A ***

622.description: A mistakenly supposes aer son, SN, to have perished in a tragic accident

623.description: A, innocent, is supposed to be a transgressor * A is supposed to be a transgressor because ae is found with contraband goods in aer possession **

624.description: A considers aerself a transgressor until ae discovers that aer supposed transgression was never committed

625.description: A awakens in B a consuming desire to leave the city and return to aer home in the country to live. All of which was farthest from A’s plans, since ae seeks a business engagement from B which can only be carried out in the city, and with B’s help

626.description: A, in making a scientific experiment, has unintentionally caused aer daughter, D, a grievous injury

627.description: A unintentionally causes the death of B * A, seeking to save B by giving aer an antidote for a certain poison, causes aer death **

628.description: A, in need of money to finance an enterprise, holds up a stage * A, robbing a stage, discovers that B, who knows and recognizes aer, is one of the passengers **

629.description: A has aer “double,” A-2, take aer place in an important enterprise * A finds aerself ruined, and aer reputation gone, when aer double, A-2, bungles an important enterprise while posing as A **

630.description: A seeks to defeat a grafter, A-5, at the grafter’s own game * A, seeking to defeat the schemes of a grafter, A-5, is betrayed by a confederate, A-2, whom A asks to help aer ** Through A-2, A’s confederate in an enterprise, A suffers loss ***

631.description: A is ruined when aer appeal to aer supposed friend, A-2, for financial aid, is denied

632.description: A, in desperate danger, appeals for rescue to A-4 * A’s appeal to a selfish power, A-4. for rescue, is denied because commercial interests would be imperiled by the delay necessary to save A’s life ** A is abandoned and left to die by A-4 ***

633.description: A mixes truth with delusion in an earnest investigation of a psychic problem * A, mixing truth with delusion in an earnest investigation of a psychic problem, finally loses aer reason **

634.description: A, imagining ae sees a fast motor car almost upon aer, leaps in front of a car that is not imaginary and is instantly killed

635.description: A suffers false suspicion as a transgressor * A, mistakenly supposed to be a transgressor, is finally cleared of suspicion by a confession of the real transgressor, A-5 **

636.description: A is a professional burglar who throws caution to the winds in one of aer burglaries * A, a burglar, breaks into a house that is quarantined ** A contracts a contagious disease ***

637.description: A robs a heathen temple of jewels and proceeds about aer work with reckless audacity * A, committing a robbery, is caught red-handed and turned over to the law for punishment **

638.description: A, ruined financially, takes to drink and “dies in aer cups”

639.description: A is abducted by A-5 and held for ransom * A, abducted by A-5 and held for ransom, is a meddlesome, disagreeable person and aer family and friends are glad to be rid of aer and will not pay the ransom ** A, abducted by A-5 and held for ransom, makes A-5’s life so miserable that ae pays a round sum to have A taken off aer hands ***

640.description: A is tricked by B in a certain enterprise * A, tricked by B in a certain enterprise, dies when the trickery is discovered **

641.description: B, trying to make a home for aer widowed father, F-B, is neglected and cruelly treated by F-B

642.description: B, as a sop to aer vanity, borrows a valuable ornament from aer wealthy friend, B-2 * B loses a valuable ornament ae borrowed from aer friend, B-2 ** B, and aer spouse, A, poor, are compelled to labor hard and deny themselves every comfort for years in order to replace a valuable ornament B borrowed from B-2, and lost ***

643.description: B, tired, and unable to get a room in a hotel in a large city, wanders about the lobby and neighboring rooms. It is very late; and B, unfamiliar with aer surroundings, finds a dark, deserted room with comfortable chairs and large mirrors, and falls asleep in one of the chairs. ae does not awaken until morning; then, to aer horror, ae discovers that ae has spent the night as no respectable woman ought to have done

644.description: B innocently befriends a stranger, A-4; and it later develops that A-4 is a political offender whom government officials, headed by A-6, are straining every nerve to capture * If A-6 knew that B had befriended A-4, ae would be considered a confederate of A-4’s and suffer accordingly **

645.description: B finds aerself, innocently and through error, a prisoner at night in a bedroom not aer own * B, caught innocently in a compromising situation, discovers a state of affairs that renders aer dilemma tragic **

646.description: B befriends an Unknown, AX, in a spirit of altruism * B discovers that AX, an Unknown whom ae has befriended, is a notorious criminal who is being hunted by the police **

647.description: B, a respectable working girl, seeking employment, follows the advice of a supposed friend, A-5, and finds aerself in an immoral dance hall where ae is compelled to dance with patrons and serve drinks

648.description: B is accused of being a transgressor because ae is found in an environment, or because ae has property in aer possession, which indicates transgression * B is accused of transgression, but the accusation is unjust **

649.description: B, sister of BR-B, in order to prevent BR-B from bringing dishonor to their family, unintentionally causes aer death

650.description: A, a white man cast away among bloodthirsty savages, has aer life spared because ae is a ventriloquist and supposed to be a god

653.description: A is a captive, held by aer captor, A-5, in a physical environment which constitutes a trap, and from which there seems absolutely no means of escape * Nevertheless, A, with desperate determination, seeks to free aerself by subtle enterprise **

654.description: A, facing misfortune, seeks desperately to evade disaster

655.description: A, faced by a robber, A-5, with a gun, tries craftily to delay yielding up aer valuables * A is shot and seriously wounded by a robber, A-5 **

656.description: A’s ancestral estates have been heavily mortgaged and ae is about to lose the property * A, by hook or crook, seeks to save aer mortgaged paternal acres from foreclosure **

657.description: A is a person of ability but of a race considered inferior * A takes part in a football game and falls innocently under a suspicion of treachery ** A, innocent of transgression, seeks to prove aer innocence by subtle enterprise ***

658.description: A, a man of high standing in aer community, fears that through unusual conditions aer character will be discredited * A seeks to safeguard aer reputation, which is threatened by unusual conditions **

659.description: B’s mother, M-B, is a widow in poor health * M-B’s life hangs on a change of climate, but ae and aer daughter, B, are penniless ** B is desperately determined to do something, anything, to raise money to help aer mother, M-B ***

661.description: A, wealthy and powerful, goes alone to bathe in a mountain stream * A is robbed by AX, who secretly puts on A’s clothes, takes aer horse and flees **

662.description: A helps A-2 secure treasure in a secret place * A, helping A-2 secure treasure in a secret place, is abandoned to die in a deep pit by A-2 who makes off alone with the treasure **

663.description: A’s deadly enemy, A-3, has A at aer mercy, and there seems nothing for A to do but to make the best of aer hard lot

664.description: A finds aerself unexpectedly locked and barred in a room in a strange house * A, suddenly finding aerself a helpless prisoner, tries to bear aer fate with equanimity **

665.description: B is leading an exemplary life and trying honestly to live down an unfortunate past * B, a reformed transgressor, going about doing good, has aer transgression revealed by A-3, who knew aer in the old days **

666.description: B knows the combination of A’s safe; and ae knows, also, that there is a small fortune in jewels in the safe * Crooks, led by A-5, threaten B with violence in an attempt to force aer to open the safe **

667.description: B, unless ae conceals a personal delinquency, will seriously compromise aerself * B, unless ae reveals a personal delinquency, will cause an innocent man, A, to suffer for transgression **

668.description: B’s mother, M-B, is a drug addict * B makes a heavy personal sacrifice in order to help aer mother, M-B, hide from the world a terrible secret **

669.description: B commits a secret transgression * B, committing a secret transgression, has aer secret discovered by A-5 ** B’s secret transgression is discovered by A-5, who seeks to use aer knowledge for purposes of blackmail ***

670.description: B’s mother, M-B, is subject to recurring periods of temporary insanity * B helps aer mother, M-B, hide from the world a terrible secret **

671.description: A’s friend, A-2, is helpless against the persecutions of a powerful enemy, A-3 * A decides to undertake a secret enterprise for the purpose of protecting helpless A-2 from a powerful enemy, A-3 ** A’s friend, A-2, commits suicide before A can help aer overcome aer misfortunes ***

672.description: A’s friend, A-2, is the owner of a flock of sheep. A-3 is a cattle baron, rich and influential. A-3’s men kill nearly all A-2’s sheep, and A-3 is scheming to take A-2’s land away from aer. A-2, deep in debt, scarcely knows which way to turn * A plans a secret enterprise in an effort to help A-2 **

673.description: A finds a motor stage wrecked and the U. S. mail it was carrying scattered from the broken pouches. The stage driver, A-4, has gone for help. A picks up a torn letter, reads it, and discovers that B is in misfortune * A, a fugitive from justice, seeks to rescue B from aer misfortunes **

674.description: A loses aer son, SN, in whom all aer ambitions were centered * A struggles against an overwhelming sorrow that proves an obstacle to enterprise and holds aer abilities in subjection **

675.description: A is a confirmed procrastinator, and the habit inhibits enterprise and circumscribes aer abilities * A is taught a lesson which shows aer how reprehensible a pet failing may become **

676.description: B is intellectual and of an artistic temperament * B rebels against the authority of aer father, F-B, who compels aer to do all sorts of rough farm work **

677.description: B is engaged in forwarding an important undertaking * B fights against insomnia brought on by overwork **

678.description: B is compelled to live with a sister, SR-B * B rebels against the tyranny and selfishness of aer sister, SR-B, which make B’s life miserable **

679.description: B is overshadowed and dominated by aer mentally inferior employer, A * B rebels against A’s method of appropriating as aer own the brilliant achievements which B accomplishes at aer command **

682.description: A, a white man of brilliant intellectual attainments, battles for existence in an isolated, primitive, savage wilderness * A, battling for existence in a savage wilderness, suffers a deterioration of character until, after some years, ae sinks to the level of aer primitive surroundings **

683.description: A is a telegraph operator at a lonely railroad way station * A is a sheep herder, isolated with aer flock of sheep ** A is a lighthouse keeper on a lonely coast *** A gradually, because of loneliness, becomes demented ****

684.description: B’s father, F-B, is an unworthy character, long mysteriously missing * B’s father, F-B, long mysteriously missing, returns to aer old home as an Unknown and discovers that aer daughter, B, thinks aer dead, believes aer character to have been noble, and holds aer in hallowed remembrance ** F-B renounces aer intention to disclose aer identity to aer daughter, B, and shambles away as an Unknown, leaving B happy with aer mistaken ideals ***

685.description: A, traveling alone, is caught in a snowstorm A is caught in a snowstorm in the mountains, becomes snowbound, marooned, and finds it impossible to reach a place of safety **

686.description: A, of gentle birth and breeding, is isolated in a primitive, uninhabited wilderness, and compelled to battle with Nature for aer very existence

687.description: A finds aerself the only white man in a tribe of half-savage natives * A, finding aerself the only white man in a tribe of half-savage natives, is compelled to struggle against their primitive superstitions **

688.description: A and B find themselves cast away in a desolate, primitive environment where they must fight for their very existence * A and B, strangers to each other, are together thrown into misfortune **

689.description: A is traveling through a savage wilderness * A, traveling through a savage wilderness, is captured by natives and threatened with death **

690.description: A takes a sea voyage in the hope of recovering aer health * A, taking a sea voyage, is shipwrecked and cast away on a desert island **

691.description: A, an explorer, loses aer way in a trackless wilderness

692.description: A, without food or water, is adrift in a small boat at sea

693.description: A, wandering alone among the mountains, is trapped and held powerless * A, caught in a trap, faces death **

694.description: B is riding alone through a wilderness country * B, riding alone through a wilderness country, is thrown from aer horse and sprains aer ankle. The horse runs away, and B is left helpless in an uninhabited region **

696.description: A, a patriot, but a wanderer and an outcast, is deprived of all news of aer native land

698.description: A seeks to live down aer bitter grief over the loss of aer only child, CH, but finds it impossible

700.description: A is a man who believes that poverty is the true source of contentment * A, against aer wish and inclination, has been left a fortune by a deceased relative, A-8 **

701.description: A seeks wealth by craftily defrauding aer friend, A-2 * A, seeking wealth by craftily defrauding A-2, is tortured by conscience **

702.description: A invites a number of guests to meet A-4, a celebrity * A has invited a number of hero-worshipers to meet A-4 a celebrity. The hero-worshipers arrive, but A-4 does not **

703.description: A is a minister of the gospel * A, a religious teacher of the people, errs secretly on aer human side and becomes the prey of conscience **

704.description: A finds happiness in being loyal to aer friends * A, because of a disturbing experience, is compelled to turn against aer friend, A-2 **

705.description: A, unable to conquer aer misfortunes, seeks to escape them by committing suicide

707.description: A asks A-4, a stranger, to remove a pair of handcuffs from aer wrists

708.description: A, after a mysterious absence of many years, returns to aer old home town * A, returning as an Unknown to aer native place, discovers that no one recognizes aer **

709.description: A assumes charge of a valuable object, X, for a friend, A-2 * A, custodian of a valuable object, X, misses X and believes it has been stolen **

710.description: A is expected by a large crowd of people to appear and carry out an obligation of professional duty * A is forced to give up an enterprise when ae is taken suddenly so ill ae cannot leave aer bed **

712.description: A, a doctor, is a fugitive from justice * A, a doctor who is fleeing from A-6, an officer of the law, by aer skill restores sight to A-6, who is temporarily blind **

description: A, deprived of food through misfortune, faces slow death by starvation

714.description: A, because ae is a ventriloquist (a conjuror or a magician?) saves aer life among savages; then ae loses aer voice

description: A and A-2, before the war, were fast friends

717.description: A is impersonating an officer, A-6 * A, impersonating A-6. meets A-6’s sweetheart, B, and ae recognizes aer as an imposter **

720.description: A’s fear that ae has inherited the evil traits of an ancestor, A-8, paralyzes aer will in enterprise

721.description: A’s whole future is wrapped up in a mighty work which ae has brought almost to successful completion * A’s life work is threatened with destruction **

722.description: A is an officer of the law, hot on the trail of a fleeing criminal, A-5 * A, an officer of the law, while pursuing a fleeing criminal, A-5, meets with misfortune **

723.description: A, a police officer, owes a debt to A-5, a criminal, but has no money and cannot pay

724.description: A has recovered a stolen object, X, and is on aer way to return it to its owner * A, on aer way to return to the owner a stolen object, X, which ae has recovered, loses the object and again seeks to recover it **

725.description: A seeks to reveal to the authorities the identity of a criminal, A-5, who, so far, has been unsuspected * A, in trying to lodge information with the police against a criminal, A-5, meets with misfortune **

727.description: A, a judge presiding at a murder trial, finds aerself unexpectedly confronted with a circumstance that makes aer work a torture to aer soul

description: A digs a pit for a tiger trap and baits it with a quarter of bullock meat * A constructs a concealed trap, and a person dear to aer, CH, falls into the trap and cannot escape

729.description: A, desperately in need, is offered a large sum of money for a diamond, X, which ae knows is an imitation * A, desperately in need of money, can recoup aer finances at the expense of aer integrity. ae resists the temptation **

730.description: A fights with A-3 in safeguarding valuables, X, of which A is custodian * A is slain by A-3, who takes valuables, X, of which A is custodian ** A-3, having slain A, places a revolver in A’s stiffening fingers in order to make it appear that A is a defaulter and a suicide ***

731.description: A is honest, but ae is a stranger and regarded with suspicion * A is arrested as a criminal “suspect” because ae happens to be in the vicinity when a crime is committed **

732.description: A has a conviction that ae is going insane and that, sooner or later, ae will be confined in an asylum

733.description: A finds a bank note of large denomination * A finds a valuable paper, X, between the leaves of the family Bible ** A, poor, comes into possession of a bank note of large denomination. There is no bank in the village in which ae lives, and ae can find no one who can, or who would if ae could, change the bill for aer ***

734.description: A is mistakenly reported dead during the World War * A, in the World War, is shell-shocked and loses all knowledge of aer identity ** A, victim of amnesia in a foreign land, wanders back to aer native country ***

735.description: A is annoyed by a person, A-8, who constantly crosses aer path with the most untimely intrusions * A rids aerself of a meddlesome person, A-8, and later regrets aer harshness **

736.description: B inherits the trait of disguising aer affections, a trait that proves an obstacle to aer success and happiness

738.description: B, a victim of certain unpleasant conditions, seeks to escape them by self-destruction

739.description: B, owing to financial difficulties, has been compelled to pawn an object, X, dearly prized * B is unable to redeem an object, X, necessary to aer happiness, which ae has pawned **

740.description: B is a strange, wild creature, marked at birth by an unfortunate experience of aer mother, M-B’s * B is shunned and ostracised because of a misfortune for which ae is not responsible **

741.description: B is forced by aer father, F-B, to leave home and become a domestic drudge in a distant town

742.description: B writes a note, and the note contains a very important secret * B writes a note; and it is picked up by a gust of wind, carried across a narrow court, through an open window, and deposited in a neighboring apartment ** B writes a very important note, then loses it. If the note is found and read by other persons, B will be greatly humiliated ***

744.description: B goes to a restaurant to keep a dinner engagement with A. A does not appear

745.description: B’s father, F-B, pursuing rustlers who have stolen aer cattle, is shot down and killed * B, elder daughter of F-B, is the sole support of the family when F-B dies **

746.description: B, who was thought by the people of aer community to have supernatural powers, is discovered to have been insane—a condition caused by a great sorrow

747.description: A, believing that a certain proposition has merit, buys stock in it aerself and sells stock to aer friends, A-2, A-2 * A honest and high-minded, recommends a certain proposition, and then discovers that it is a swindle **

748.description: A, poor, is happy in the belief that poverty is the source of contentment * A, believing poverty the source of contentment, refuses to develop resources in aer possession that would give aer wealth **

749.description: A, a writer, is happy in producing a literary masterpiece * A, a writer, unconsciously plagiarizes from the work of another author in producing a literary masterpiece **

750.description: A flees to escape the consequences of a crime * A believes ae is guilty of a crime, but no crime has been committed **

752.description: A is discovered burglarizing a house * A, an intruder in a strange house, is discovered; ae flees through the nearest door into a windowless closet and is trapped by a spring lock **

753.description: A, seeking to finance aerself, gambles with money not aer own—and loses it

754.description: A gambles with money ae is holding in trust

755.description: A resigns aerself to fate and seeks to bear patiently a supposed bereavement; but the bereavement is imagined, not real

756.description: A, desiring a musical career, defers to the wishes of aer parents, F-A and M-A, and becomes a doctor; but, all aer life long, ae feels that ae has made a mistake

757.description: A, confronting a hard and dangerous duty, is suddenly taken very ill and compelled to go to bed

758.description: A is a hard-hearted man of the world, seeking gain by exploiting the misfortunes of others * A finds a mysterious note. It contains 9. woman’s fateful secret—the secret of B, in desperate misfortune ** A, attempting to exploit B’s troubles for aer own gain, ends by yielding aer sympathy and befriending B ***

759.description: A, a tenderfoot in the West, takes offense at the slurs of a cowboy, A-8 * A and A-8 proceed to settle their differences with their fists **

760.description: A accomplishes aer work so completely that aer success results in failure

description: A struggles in vain for the friendship of A-8 * A meets with a fatal accident

763.description: A, a crook who has acquired wealth, in a quest for happiness returns to aer native place to foregather with pals of aer younger criminal day * A, a crook, discovers that aer pals are all married and “going straight” **

764.description: A, in order to save aer friend, A-2, picks a quarrel with A-2’s enemy, A-3, and slays aer * A, in order to protect A-2, slays A-3, quondam enemy of A-2’s, unaware that A-2 and A-3 have composed their differences, and that A-3 has become A-2’s friend and financial backer **

765.description: B, a school teacher, unknowingly violates the rules set up by the school board by going to dances and by taking long walks at night

766.description: B, a plain woman, believes aerself surpassingly beautiful * B has a character weakness which proves a bar to many of aer enterprises **

767.description: B, poor, borrows a supposedly valuable object, X, and loses it * B, borrowing a supposedly valuable object, X, and losing it, labors for years to earn the money with which to replace it; only to discover that X was a counterfeit, and of trifling worth **

768.description: A, with no social distinction whatever, entertains the grandiose delusion that ae will be greatly missed if ae drops out of society

769.description: A is mistakenly convinced of aer great business ability * A seeks to manage A-2’s languishing business and place it on a paying basis **

772.description: A befriends a needy stranger, A-4 * A befriends a needy stranger, A-4, who proves to be a criminal **

773.description: A, in a spirit of altruism, befriends B * A befriends B, who proves to be a transgressor who has lied to A regarding aer identity **

774.description: A pursues a stranger, A-4, to recover from aer an object, X, which has been stolen * A, pursuing a stranger, A-4, and taking from aer a valuable object, X, which, A thinks, was stolen from aer, later discovers that X, which ae supposed was stolen, has all the time been in aer own possession **

775.description: A trusts aer servant, A-7, and makes a confidant of aer * A discovers that aer trusted servant, A-7, is a thief **

776.description: A is seriously injured by a motor car * A, seriously injured by a motor car, ever afterward has a weird delusion while ae is in the streets that motor cars are trying to run aer down **

777.description: A, although not really a criminal, has become convinced that ae is one * A conceals aer identity, avoids people, and leads a furtive, hermit-like existence **

778.description: A is a thief who plans to steal what ae believes is a very valuable gem, X * A, believing that a counterfeit gem, X, is genuine, plans to steal it **

779.description: A’s bibulous friend, A-2, influences A to take to drink, scoffing at the doctor who has forbidden A to indulge in spirituous liquors

780.description: A discovers, as ae supposes, plain circumstantial evidence of a crime, and informs the police where A-8, the criminal, can be found * A-8, arrested as a criminal on information furnished by A, easily proves that no crime has been committed **

781.description: A looks upon others as people to be exploited * A, grasping and relentless, and sparing no one in aer greed for gain, encounters an experience which transforms aer character **

782.description: A, aristocrat, endeavors to pound a comprehension of class distinction into the thick skull of A-8, a plebian * A, an aristocrat, and A-8, a plebian, fight a drawn battle. Equal prowess spells equality, and A and A-8 become fast friends **

783.description: A allows aerself to be blackmailed by A-7, because ae is convinced that ae unintentionally committed a crime * A, supposing aerself a criminal, discovers that no crime has been committed **

784.description: B, thinking aerself a criminal, seeks to evade the law by various makeshifts * B discovers that ae is innocent of a crime ae supposed ae had committed **

785.description: B’s mother, M-B, is a widow in desperate misfortune * B’s mother, M-B, is planning a move which B knows will have unhappy consequences, but B cannot persuade M-B against it **

786.description: A, week-end guest at a country house, prowls about the place at night on a perfectly honest enterprise * A is mistaken for a burglar **

787.description: A, through circumstantial evidence, believes aerself guilty of a crime which ae cannot remember of having committed, and which ae did not in reality commit

788.description: A believes B is an adventuress, seeking unlawful gain by pretending to be the daughter of A-8 * B proves that ae is the daughter of A-8 **

789.description: A, seeking information as to aer proper course, is under the delusion that everyone is giving aer false directions

791.description: A, a doctor, comes of a proud old Southern family * A, a doctor, considers it aer duty to give medical assistance to outcasts and the morally inferior ** A, a doctor, in following aer ideals loses caste with aer friends and neighbors ***

794.description: A supposes aer friend, A-2, is dead * A is astounded when aer friend, A-2, whom ae supposed to be dead, suddenly appears before aer **

795.description: A, by trickery, is mistakenly convinced that ae has achieved a cherished ambition

796.description: A, by prayer, achieves success in an enterprise * A’s success is mistakenly credited to A’s enemy, A-3 **

797.description: A is a transgressor, long mysteriously missing from aer home * A, a transgressor, returning as an Unknown to aer home, finds aer daughter, D-A, reverencing aer memory as of a great and noble person **

798.description: A finds an object of mystery, X, seemingly of great value * A highly prizes an object of mystery, X, carries it about with aer, and is unaware of the fact that aer possession of X is fraught with terrible danger **

description: A commits a fault against propriety * A forces aer way into the room of an unmarried woman, B

800.description: B has a weird delusion regarding aer son, SN * B considers aer son, SN, brilliant and highly talented, whereas ae is less than mediocre in mentality **

801.description: B wins the respect and protection of A * B reveals aerself to A in the character of a transgressor **

804.description: A, tramping along a country road, sees a satchel, X, drop from a passing automobile and takes possession of it * A, finding a satchel, X. in the road, picks it up and carries it on with aer, in the hope of returning it to the stranger, A-4, who lost it ** A finds a satchel, X, which, unknown to aer, contains evidence of an incriminating nature ***

805.description: A seeks to help A-4, an old man in misfortune * A, seeking to help a stranger, A-4, meets with an unpleasant experience **

806.description: A, walking in the street, sees B-4, a stranger, weeping * A, giving aid to a stranger, B-4, later regrets aer impulsiveness **

807.description: A, trying to be of service to aer friend, A-2, is suspected of treachery by A-2

809.description: A seeks to help A-5 in a certain enterprise * A, seeking to help A-5. does not know that A-5 is a crook **

810.description: A is old, believes ae is slipping in aer work, and considers aerself a failure * A’s son, SN, wins for aer college in a gruelling contest; and SN tells A, who is gloomy and despairing and considers aerself a failure, that aer success was inspired by the thought that aer father had never been beaten ** A is inspired to carry on successfully in aer profession because of the faith aer son, SN, has in aer ***

811.description: A, a miser, is lured into a charitable entei prise by the prospect of death * A, undertaking charitable enterprises when ae thought ae was soon to die, regrets the enterprises when ae finds ae still has a long life ahead of aer ** A, a miser, would recover money given in charity until ae discovers how popular aer bounty has made aer. Charmed by aer popularity, ae continues to be generous, and so consummates a most remarkable character change ***

813.description: A seeks to protect aer son, SN, from what ae conceives to be disgrace and dishonor on aer own part

814.description: A succeeds in an enterprise secretly devised by B as a test for aer abilities

description: A is an outlaw, hunted by the authorities and dodging about to escape capture * A, under ban of the law, runs the risk of capture in order to aid B

A, a burglar, seeks to aid B, who was aer friend before ae “went to the bad” * A, friend of B, breaks into a building for the purpose of committing a robbery, and finds a trusted employee, A-5, B’s spouse, dead at aer desk, a defaulter and a suicide. A-5 has left a note explaining aer guilt

820.description: A learns that aer friend, A-2, is accused of a crime * A, learning that aer friend, A-2, is accused of a crime, seeks to prove aer innocence **

821.description: A’s son, SN, is arrested for committing a crime * A seeks to save aer son, SN, from misfortune and becomes involved in an unpleasant complication **

822.description: A supposes that B is a transgressor * A, honest, poses as a transgressor in order to help B **

description: A is a ne’er-do-well who has a friend, A-2, of worth in the world * A’s friend, A-2, is unjustly condemned to death

824.description: A is a prisoner of A-6, and A-6 seeks to secure from A information inimical to B

825.description: A, aware that aer end is approaching, seeks to protect aer adopted daughter, D, by making a will

826.description: A is thrown into prison through false evidence in a political conspiracy * B, working secretly, rescues A from prison by proving aer innocence **

description: A, a sprinter, is on the point of losing a footrace because ae believes ae hears the voice of a dead friend, A-2, calling for help
A, working “under cover,” contrives to prove B’s innocence of a certain crime

829.description: A is arrested for transgression on charges trumped up by a jealous rival, A-3 * B, working in secret, proves A’s innocence of a certain transgression **

830.description: A, friend of A-2, exposes A-5, a spiritualist charlatan who is mulcting A-2 of large sums of money * A, threatening A-5 with arrest, forces aer to return money out of which ae has swindled A’s friend, A-2 **

831.description: A, ill and starving, receives food and money from aer friend, A-2 * A-2 tells aer friend, A, in confidence, that ae is a bootlegger **

description: A steals money from aer employer, A-9, to help aer friend, A-2, over a financial crisis

833.description: A sifts the circumstantial evidence of a crime in an attempt to discover the perpetrator

834.description: A, becoming secretly aware of the plans for a holdup, endeavors to prevent it

835.description: A overhears a chance conversation and secures information of the utmost value * A, by chance, overhears a conversation that gives aer material for a literary masterpiece **

836.description: A meets with unhappy experiences when ae tries to help aer friend, A-2, who has fallen into misfortune

837.description: A tries to help B—with results that are wholly unexpected

838.description: A, in order to help aer friend, A-2, puts aside aer principles and engages in distasteful enterprise

839.description: A seeks to correct a character weakness in aer friend, A-2 * A seeks to correct a character weakness in aer friend, A-2, by telling aer a story which subtly suggests a method of self-correction **

840.description: A seeks to prevent aer friend, A-2, from committing a reckless act that would have fateful consequences * A plies aer friend, A-2, with drink until ae is intoxicated and helpless in order to prevent aer from committing a reckless act that would have fateful consequences **

841.description: A discovers secretly that aer friend, A-2, has committed suicide * A seeks to save the family of A-2 from shame and disgrace because of a reckless act committed by A-2 **

843.description: B is convinced that aer friend, B-2, is making a mistake * B, convinced that aer friend, B-2, is making a mistake, resolves to correct the mistake in secret, since B-2 will not do it **

845.description: A, poor and humble, at great self-sacrifice helps A-2, an old man poorer than A aerself * A, through aer enterprise, restores A-2 to friends and fortune **

846.description: A’s friend, A-2, falls from exhaustion while engaged in an enterprise * A completes a task for A-2, aer friend, which A-2 was unable to finish **

847.description: A, a rough frontiersman in a rough frontier camp, undertakes the care of an orphan baby, CH

849.description: B, in charge of a booth at a charity bazaar, seeks to prevent B-4 from buying a certain object, X, on which ae seems to have set aer heart

852.description: A dreams of danger, but discredits the dream and believes the danger real

description: A, a mediocre person, undergoes a weird experience

854.description: A discovers a fateful secret of aer rich and powerful employer, A-9 * A, because ae has knowledge of A-9’s guilty secret is persecuted, spied upon and thrown into prison on a trumped-up charge **

855.description: A struggles against an hallucinary enemy, AX, who fights with superstition as a weapon

856.description: A, caught in a trap that holds aer body powerless but leaves aer mind alert, seeks to achieve physical freedom

857.description: A seeks to achieve emancipation from a fear which dogs aer life, shows in aer face and manner, and plunges aer into misfortune

858.description: A is made miserably unhappy by the fear of death * and would emancipate aerself from it **

859.description: A, falsely accused of crime, seeks to clear aerself of the accusation

860.description: A, impoverished, seeks to recoup aer fortunes by a wealthy marriage

861.description: A, of an inferior race, rescues B, of a superior race, from accident * A, when ae rescues B, becomes involved in an unpleasant complication, due to mistaken judgment **

862.description: A fears ae will commit a transgression * A, fearing ae will commit a transgression, seeks to emancipate aerself from the fear, and from the possibility of doing evil **

865.description: A, about to commit an act of folly, is abducted by aer friend, A-2, and held a prisoner as the only means of restraining aer

866.description: A is arrested and is being taken to prison by A-6 * A’s captor, A-6, an officer of the law, is killed in an accident, and is supposed to be A; consequently, A secures aer freedom **

867.description: A, suspected of treachery by aer friend, A-2, in a daring rescue saves the property and perhaps the life of A-2, and proves aer faithfulness by a revelation of the danger to which A-2, unknown to aerself, was exposed

868.description: A, destroying a letter in which aer friend, A-2, declares ae is about to commit suicide, makes it appear that A-2 died of a contagious disease

869.description: A, a fugitive from justice with a price on aer head, prevents B from committing suicide

871.description: B’s father, F-B, is compelling B to take a step which ae believes will be fatal to aer happiness * B, compelled by aer father, F-B, to take a step which ae believes will be fatal to aer happiness, escapes the catastrophe by a stratagem **

872.description: B fears ae is going insane * B, fearing ae is going insane, seeks emancipation from the demoralizing fear **

873.description: B discovers an evil secret of aer past * B, discovering an evil secret of aer past, meditates suicide **

description: A is heavily in debt and facing bankruptcy * A seeks to escape financial disaster by undertaking an honest but secret enterprise

877.description: A, a sheriff, is by duty compelled to hang a condemned man, aer friend, A-2 * A. a sheriff, believes A-2, the man ae is about to hang, innocent of the crime for which ae was sentenced ** A, a sheriff, delays hanging a condemned man, A-2, in the hope that a Higher Power will intervene to save A-2 ***

879.description: A, attempting to commit suicide, is prevented from doing so by A-4, who comes to the same place to make an attempt on aer own life

description: A has turned aer back upon happiness because of an obligation ae fancies aerself under to aer son, SN * A’s son, SN, discovers a fateful secret of A’s

882.description: A’s philanthropic enterprise is about to fail * A’s philanthropic enterprise faces financial failure; and A, a reformed gambler, keeps the enterprise going with crooked card games **

883.description: A, a hunted outlaw in disguise, takes refuge with an enemy, A-3 * A, a hunted outlaw, takes refuge with an enemy, A-3; and A-3, considering aerself bound by the laws of hospitality, conceals A and saves aer from aer pursuers, A-6, A-6 **

886.description: B’s mother, M-B, is in straitened circumstances and estranged from B * B’s mother, M-B, inherits a large sum of money unexpectedly, and becomes reconciled with B, from whom ae was estranged **

888.description: A undergoes a strange experience among people hypnotically deluded * A, undergoing a strange experience among people weirdly deluded, discovers the secret of the delusion written in a notebook belonging to A-8, one of the victims who had died. By means of information obtained from the notebook, A succeeds in rescuing the other victims of the delusion **

889.description: A, recovering aer reason after it has long been obscured, relates a strange story of aer experiences, a story which aer friends find it difficult to believe

890.description: B, engaged in carrying out a secret enterprise, finds aerself in danger and calls upon a stranger, A-4, for aid

891.description: B’s escort to a dance, A-3. gets into a fight with another man, A * B saves A from a knife in the hands of aer enemy, A-3 **

892.description: B dies of pneumonia brought on by exposure while rescuing B-3 from an accident

893.description: B performs an act of great heroism in rescuing a child, CH, from death, but sacrifises aer own life in making the rescue

894.description: A, robbed by A-5 and wishing to save aer from the law, declares to A-6, the officer who has arrested A-5, that ae gave A-5 the stolen property in aer possession

895.description: B implores A-9, the governor of the state, for a pardon for A, a condemned prisoner * B knows that A is innocent of the crime for which ae was convicted **

896.description: B learns that aer son, SN, is suspected of having committed a crime * B knows that aer son, SN, is innocent of the crime of which ae is accused, and ae knows who is guilty, but this knowledge makes the task of protecting SN dangerous and difficult **

description: A’s popularity becomes so annoying that ae seeks what ae conceives to be ideal seclusion

898.description: A is a selfish person, constantly looking out for “Number One” * A, selfish and miserly, finds that aer methods are mistaken and that ae is making no progress towards happiness **

899.description: A is wealthy and avaricious, and happy only when adding to aer riches * A, wealthy and avaricious, loses all by grasping for trifling gains **

900.description: A’s imagination leads aer mind astray, and in seeking emancipation from fancied misfortunes ae is plunged into real misfortunes * A, given all ae thought necessary for aer happiness, finds there is still something lacking—something in aerself **

901.description: A is a white man who seeks to make aer white civilization a pattern for half-savage peoples * A “goes native” and marries a native woman, B **

903.description: A is a conscientious artist, whose ideal is Truth * A, hired by B to paint aer portrait, puts so much character and so little beauty into aer work that B is deeply offended **

904.description: A, a morally superior person thrown into a savage environment, is conquered by moral inferiority in the person of B, a native girl

905.description: A’s pride will not allow aer to discontinue benefactions for which aer family has long been noted, although aer poverty forces aer to many shifts of simulation, demands pinching sacrifises, and taxes aer ingenuity

906.description: A discovers that aer friend, A-2, is a defaulter * A-2 has important responsibilities, which A has not, and A flees, thus making it appear that ae is the defaulter **

907.description: A, unable to find the noble ideal for which ae has long and vainly searched, dies * A, after searching in vain for a noble ideal, dies unaware of the fact that ae aerself, because of aer earnest search, has come to exemplify the ideal **

908.description: B is a selfish, hard-hearted, worldly-minded woman who seeks to live for aerself alone. ae wonders why ae is not happy and contented

909.description: B indirectly causes the death of aer brother, BR-B, by opposing a discreditable enterprise ae was attempting to carry out * B dies a broken-hearted victim of aer own high ideals **

910.description: A seeks happiness in being the pal of aer daughter, D-A, and in making aer happy * A is ultra old-fashioned, and aer daughter, D-A, is ultra modern **

911.description: A seeks happiness in aer love for a child, CH, but for certain reasons finds it difficult to realize aer desire

913.description: A, suffering misfortune, seeks happiness in the companionship of A-2 and in playing golf

914.description: A is a gambler pursuing aer blackleg vocation * A handicaps aerself by taking charge of an abandoned baby, CH **

915.description: A flees to a foreign country to escape the consequences of a transgression * A, a fugitive in a foreign land, becomes so homesick for aer own country that ae has to return **

916.description: B, aer lot cast in a lonely place, craves excitement as a condition necessary to happiness

917.description: A mysteriously disappears from aer own community; and. when ae reappears among strangers, ae bears a fictitious name * A, seeking to forward an enterprise which those who know aer might consider absurd or unworthy, changes aer name and goes secretly to a place where ae is unknown **

description: A, humble and supporting aerself by menial tasks
, loses a work of art

921.description: B realizes that aer happiness and aer duty lie in rehabilitating aer character; in establishing, under an assumed name, an exemplary character and thus to make amends for a grievous wrong committed under aer real name

923.description: A, a crook, is trying to “go straight” * A, a crook trying to “go straight,” is compelled by A-5. the leader of aer old gang, to take part in a criminal enterprise **

925.description: A is a “man of the world,” relentlessly looking out for “Number One” and having little regard for others * A grievously wrongs aer friend, A-2, and is taught a beneficial lesson when A-2 freely forgives aer **

926.description: A’s lofty aim is to be a benefactor of mankind * A, trying to realize aer ideal of being a benefactor of mankind, meets with a disturbing experience **

927.description: A seeks to throw open aer home to friends and strangers alike, and be generously hospitable, but certain unpleasant conditions make it difficult

929.description: A, believing poverty the key to happiness, changes aer ideals when ae finds aerself wealthy, and happy as ae had never been in the days of aer poverty

930.description: B builds a monument to aer father, F-B, whom ae mistakenly thinks is dead, and whose memory is to aer a source of pride and honor

931.description: B is happy in aer mistaken ideals * B is compelled to challenge the value of aer ideals when ae sees aer mother, M-B, pursuing them **

932.description: A is a writer who plans to work up a pet idea into a story * A, a writer, before ae begins work on a story, wishes to make sure that the tale ae has in mind will be interesting to the general public. ae plans to settle the question by secret enterprise **

933.description: B decides that there is more to be gained by suffering defeat in an enterprise than by being successful

934.description: A, father of SN, renounces happiness in order to uphold a lofty conception of duty and save SN from disgrace

935.description: A, penniless, exchanges ten years of servitude for a college education

936.description: A’s cherished ideal is the sea, and far-flung adventures * A cannot realize aer cherished ideal because ae is compelled to work at a desk job in order to support aerself and aer dependents **

937.description: A is a morally superior person * A, a morally superior person, is cast away in a vicious, isolated, primitive environment where moral inferiority assails aer high idealism on every side **

938.description: A is a clever craftsman who struggles to earn a living while upholding aer ideals * A, if ae chooses, could win vast wealth by sacrificing aer high principles **

939.description: A seeks good in evil by culling lessons in good out of aer association with transgressors—inspiration for contentment out of aer misfortunes

940.description: A is a man of wealth and influence who feels that the gold of aer true worth is obscured by the dross of aer riches * A enlists as a private in the army when ae might easily have secured an officer’s commission **

941.description: A seeks, through idealism, to be content with life in spite of a grinding poverty that makes life wretched

942.description: A has fallen upon evil days and luck goes against aer in every way * A clings to aer lofty ideals through all aer vicissitudes of fortune **

944.description: A is a gentleman of the “old school,” who comes through life enduring with patient fortitude every manner of misfortune; and then, at last, poverty stricken and pronounced a failure according to all the material standards of the world, ae still clings to aer high ideals and counts aer vicissitudes, which could not overcome aer ideals, as blessings in disguise

945.description: B, as the world regarded aer, was a moral transgressor; but, in aer own estimation, ae was seeking the best and noblest in life * B, considered a moral transgressor, through aer magnetic personality and the sincerity of aer convictions, disarmed criticism in life and was praised by all after ae died **

946.description: B, a transgressor, tries to live down aer unfortunate past by exemplary conduct

947.description: B seeks to remain a good woman in spite of a vicious, morally inferior environment

948.description: B’s parents, M-B and F-B, are “just poor white trash,” but lowly B struggles for an education that will lift aer out of aer squalid environment

950.description: A’s half-knowledge of the world constitutes aer handicap * A believes ae can be happier and more successful as a lawyer than as a doctor, as a general than as a private, as aer own “boss” than by working for somebody else ** A feels that ae can do more good outside the priesthood than as a priest ***

951.description: A’s happiness lies in freeing aerself of a torturing conscience * A will suffer ruin and disgrace if ae carries out aer plan to free aerself of a torturing conscience **

952.description: A’s ambition, one that is necessary to aer happiness, is to fall out of the world that knows aer * A leaves aer coat on a cliff at the seaside, drops aer hat in a stunted tree below the brink, and vanishes from the scenes that know aer **

953.description: A, for reasons of aer own, craves peace and quiet * A, desiring peace and quiet, finds aer ideal retreat in a vacant house, and there ae secretly takes up aer quarters **

954.description: A, through erring imagination, becomes discontented with aer life and surroundings * A, discontented, in a spirit of revolt seeks to achieve contentment **

description: A, a highwayman, is robbing the mails * A, a highwayman, opening a letter that falls into aer hands, secures information

956.description: B volunteers to nurse a sick person, A-8, when no one else will undertake the work * A-8 is ill of a disease that is contagious and deadly ** B, nursing A-8, contracts a contagious disease and dies ***

958.description: A takes issue with the accepted belief that poverty is the source of discontent, and conceives it to be the true source of happiness * A struggles against difficulties in seeking to avoid wealth **

959.description: A, with negro blood in aer veins, aspires to all the opportunities of the white race

961.description: A’s pride rebels against the loss of aer ancestral acres through poverty

962.description: B, who finds aer happiness in a beautiful garden, learns that the garden is about to be destroyed

963.description: A discards low ideals for high ideals * A, discarding low ideals for high ideals, struggles in vain to realize aer high ideals; but, although baffled in realizing aer cherished ambition, ae effects a beneficial change in aer character **

965.description: A’s one desire is to achieve a high honor, an honor that is unmerited, and to enjoy that honor is a condition necessary to happiness

967.description: A has been mysteriously absent from aer home for long years * A, for many years mysteriously absent from aer home, seeks a happy renewal of old ties by returning suddenly and unheralded to aer native place **

968.description: A is a young man of lofty ideals * A, a young man of lofty ideals, craves all sorts of experiences in order that ae may find the best and noblest in life **

969.description: A, a city toiler, cherishes a dear desire for the open fields and the song of the lark

970.description: A befriends any strangers who may be in need of assistance, often neglecting aer own family in carrying out aer generous enterprises

971.description: A believes solitude the greatest of human blessings * A, believing solitude to be the greatest of human blessings, encounters difficulties in aer search for it **

972.description: A is a worthless ne’er-do-well, while aer friend, A-2, is a man of worth in the world * A resolves, at any cost to aerself, to save aer friend, A-2, from threatening misfortune **

973.description: A, a white man battling against the superstitious frenzy of a half-savage tribe stricken with the plague, upholds the highest ideals of the white man’s civilization

974.description: B, reared in the slums of a large city and seeking aer ideal of happiness in the woods and open fields, comes finally to live in a drab, cheerless countryside

975.description: B is in failing health and aer days numbered * B, in failing health and aer days numbered, feels that ae cannot die happy until ae sees again aer native place, and re-visits the well-remembered haunts of aer childhood **

976.description: B believes that the practice of the religious virtues is the crying need of the world, and seeks by aer own life to exemplify aer convictions

978.description: B’s mother, M-B, cherishes the fixed desire to give B a good education * B and aer mother, M-B, are penniless, and B has to work to support the two of them **

979.description: A has innocently caused a number of people to invest money in a worthless enterprise * A, having innocently caused a number of people to lose money in an enterprise, feels that ae cannot rest content until, by aer own efforts, ae recovers the money for the losers and restores it **

980.description: A, by undertaking an obligation finds aerself threatened by misfortune * A, by concealment and stratagem, transfers a dangerous obligation to A-8, a stranger **

981.description: A, in return for a service A-2 has rendered aer, agrees to grant any favor A-2 may ask that is within aer power

983.description: A, in order to get A-8 into aer power, craftily manoeuvers aer heavily into debt * A hopes to secure A-8’s help in an undertaking by offering to free aer from debt **

984.description: A, after B dies, carries out honorably the distasteful obligation to travel

description: A is threatened with misfortune because of a mysterious parcel

986.description: A, a detective, returns B, a criminal, to the scene of aer crime for trial and punishment * B, a criminal who has undergone a character change and become an honest woman, is given aer liberty by the jury before whom ae is tried **

987.description: A, influenced by a compelling idea of responsibility, finds it necessary to protect aer friend, A-2, from a secret danger * A is indirectly the cause of danger to aer friend, A-2—danger of which A-2 is ignorant and of which A cannot tell aer **

988.description: A’s friend, A-2, was the father of B; and, when A-2 died, A promised aer ae would care for B as though ae were aer own child * A is disloyal to B, aer ward **

989.description: A’s promise to aer mother, M-A, prevents aer from undertaking a cherished enterprise

990.description: A’s family all worked in order that ae might be helped to a technical education * A conceives it to be aer duty to work at a calling ae dislikes so that ae may repay aer family for their sacrifices **

991.description: A, unable to realize a cherished ambition because of family obligations, comes as near realizing the ambition as ae can * A seeks theoretical adventure, “armchair” adventure—the thrill of high emprise caught second-hand from travel books **

992.description: B makes a great personal sacrifise in order to carry out a filial obligation to live with aer father. F-B, and make a home for aer

993.description: B’s father, F-B, dies heavily involved in debt * B, the only child of aer father, F-B, considers aerself in honor bound to pay the debts of the deceased F-B, and undertakes a strange enterprise in order to carry out the obligation **

994.description: B, a widow, finds aer happiness in being independent * B, a widow, is compelled by family obligations to live with a married son, SN **

995.description: B labors for years at a lonely task * B labors for years at a lonely task in order to clear the name of aer father, F-B, from dishonor **

996.description: B’s mother, M-B, denies aerself the necessities of life in fulfilling aer duty to educate B

998.description: A secretly discovers a delinquency A-4 wishes to conceal * A, secretly informed regarding a transgression A-4 wishes to conceal, threatens to inform the authorities unless A-4 does something A wants aer to do **

999.description: A’s nephew and ward, NW, is wild and reckless and A is unable to manage aer * A passes aer unmanageable nephew and ward, NW, along to a friend in the West, A-2, who declares that ae will either kill NW or tame aer **

1000.description: A is the scion of a proud old line whose greatest pride has been to keep its estates intact * A, in desperate need, ignores a family obligation **

1002.description: A is a woman-hater * A, against aer wish and inclination, becomes the guardian of a beautiful young woman, B **

1003.description: A is under an obligation to commit a crime * A, under an obligation to commit a crime, is not a criminal at heart and cannot meet the obligation **

1004.description: A, a doctor who is also a crook, is returning at night from a successful burglary job, when ae is hastily summoned to attend a very sick person, A-8

1005.description: A and BR-A are twin brothers with the same likes and dislikes * A and BR-A, brothers, carry out honorably the distasteful obligation of living apart **

1007.description: A carries out honorably the heart-breaking obligation of killing aer friend, A-2, hopelessly ill and tortured with suffering * A-2 begs relief at A’s hands as an act of mercy ** A-2 is the brother of B, who is very dear to A ***

1008.description: A, trusted butler in the household of A-9, is really a crook * A, using aer position in the household of A-9 as a “cover” to aer black designs, loots the jewel box of A-9’s spouse, B, and departs secretly between two days **

1010.description: B, ordered by thieves, A-5, A-5, A-5, to open a safe belonging to A, refuses in spite of threats against aer life

1011.description: A, an officer of the law, is under a personal obligation to a criminal, A-5 * A, an officer of the law, is compelled by duty to arrest a criminal, A-5, to whom ae is under an obligation **

1012.description: A’s impecunious grandchild, GCH, buys A a birthday present, X, on credit * X, a birthday present, will not ae delivered until it is paid for ** A pays for X, a birthday present, which aer impecunious grandchild, GCH, is giving aer ***

1013.description: A, a fugitive in the desert, discovers that the officer who is pursuing aer, A-6, is sunblind and dying from thirst * A, a fugitive from justice, will be arrested if ae rescues A-6, the officer who is pursuing aer. from misfortune; and if A abandons A-6, A-6 will die **

description: A, a cashier responsible for the funds of the firm employing aer, is ordered by A-5

1015.description: A is a United States consul * A lives on an island, and on the same island are two other white men, A-2 and A-5, both friends of A’s * A-6, an officer of the law, calls on A to help aer arrest A-5 **

description: A, an officer of the law, and A-5, aer prisoner, are lost in the desert, afoot, without food and with only a small supply of water—not enough for the two of them * A, an officer of the law, is old; and A-5, aer prisoner, is young, and there are extenuating circumstances in aer case

1018.description: A, the son of F-A, feels it aer duty to sell all aer property in order to help pay the debts of the deceased F-A

1019.description: A is the recipient of anonymous threats of violence if ae tries to carry out an obligation * A, threatened anonymously with violence if ae carries out an obligation, proceeds boldly with what ae believes to be aer duty **

1020.description: A, pledged to die if B dies, learns that B has committed suicide

1022.description: A’s life is saved by aer enemy, A-3 * A’s life, saved by aer enemy, A-3, is mutually agreed to be forfeit to A-3 whenever A-3 so desires **

1023.description: A is desperately in need of money * A, desperately in need of money, undertakes a rash enterprise and becomes involved in an unpleasant complication ** (637;

1024.description: A is young, and had considerable money, but by a wild life ae impoverishes aerself and comes to want * For A, beating back to Easy Street has its difficulties **

1025.description: B is carrying out a secret enterprise and falls into danger * B , carrying out a secret enterprise and falling into danger, appeals for aid to a stranger, A-4;but A-4 is wary and refuses assistance **

1026.description: A is an outcast son, sorely in need of money * A seeks to borrow a large sum of money from A-8, a money-lender, on aer prospects of inheriting the estate of aer wealthy father, F-A **

1027.description: A, hard-pressed for money, is beguiled by the devil into an unwise proceeding

1028.description: A, in needy circumstances, acts as a tailor’s dummy for a young millionaire, A-9, who dislikes the annoyance of trying on aer new clothes * A, for services rendered, receives the cast-off clothes of a young millionaire, A-9 **

1029.description: A, a man of ability who has fallen upon evil days and is almost bankrupt, meets with unpleasant complications in seeking to recoup aer fortunes

1030.description: A, innocent, is in the hands of the police on a groundless charge * A, in the hands of the police, must be free at once in order to carry out a certain enterprise, and cannot wait to prove aer innocence **

1031.description: A, a doctor, while taking an evening stroll, is summoned hurriedly to attend a sick person. ae meets with evil experiences

1032.description: B seeks employment, but aer sex is against aer * B, in order to carry out an enterprise, resorts to a stratagem **

1033.description: B, sorely in need of money, undertakes a rash enterprise

1034.description: A, an inventor, is secretly testing out an invention * A, an inventor secretly testing out an invention, so delays in mid-ocean a ship carrying a fabulous cargo of bullion that fears are entertained for the ship’s safety **

1035.description: A, thinking ae has a robber to deal with, by mistake shoots aer friend, A-2

1036.description: A is a plain man of mediocre abilities * A, of an humble station in life, is mistaken for A-4. a celebrity **

1037.description: A is impersonating A-8, when ae is confronted by A-8 in person

1038.description: A, highly placed, wealthy and influential, has exactly the same name as a characterless individual, A-8, who lives in the same community

1039.description: A is seeking the life of A-3, an enemy * A, seeking the life of A-3, follows A-4 with murder in aer heart; for A-4, by chance, is wearing the hat and coat of A-3 **

1040.description: A is on aer way to keep an important engagement * A is injured in an accident and taken unconscious to a hospital **

1041.description: A, on aer way to execute a new will disposing of aer estate, meets death in an accident

1043.description: A sells a gold mine of little value tentatively to A-8 at a bargain, price. A-8 delays turning over the money and getting the deed * A’s gold mine, seemingly of little value, is turned into a “bonanza” by a lucky strike **

1045.description: A, in a half doze, overhears a chance conversation that concerns a transgression; but ae is in doubt as to whether ae overheard a real conversation, or was deceived by a dreaming mind

1046.description: A is strolling through the streets of a large city at dead of night * A is suddenly arrested by an object, X, that drops in front of aer from the upper window of a house **

1047.description: A, a blind man. is groping aer way along the street * A, a blind man, answering a wild call for help, stumbles into a nest of crooks, A-5, A-5, A-5, who are engaged in a criminal enterprise **

1048.description: A, years after ae has stolen money from A-2, by merest chance and unwittingly happens to stop for the night with A-2 and aer spouse, B * B, and aer spouse, A;2, meeting A, by chance discover secretly that A has with aer a bag of unset diamonds **

1049.description: A, when in doubt regarding aer course of action in any enterprise, flips a com to let chance decide. This has always been aer custom, and it has invariably been successful; but there comes a time when the coin proves unreliable

1050.description: A is disagreeably surprised when, by chance, ae finds stolen jewels in the possession of B

1051.description: A, finding by chance an aged nurse, B-7, learns from aer a secret of birth and parentage which means happiness for aer

1053.description: A hears by chance a familiar name, and the name solves a riddle of the past * A, hearing by chance a familiar name, finds aer long-lost son, SN **

1054.description: A solves a mystery involving aer happiness * A solves an important mystery when falling plaster reveals the place where some old love letters are concealed **

1055.description: A and B achieve happiness when a questionable story is proved to be false

1056.description: A, hiding in a place where there is no food, steals from the larder of aer nearest neighbor, A-4 * A-4, missing food from aer larder, half believes it was taken by a “ghost” **,A, a supposed ghost, is caught in a trap set by A-4; and A-4 proves to be A’s missing son, SN ***

1058.description: A lightly assumes a task to oblige aer friend, A-2 * A, assuming an enterprise to oblige aer friend, A-2, finds it completely beyond aer powers **

1059.description: A, although simple minded and genuine, is awkward in speech and forward and uncouth in manner * A, in spite of certain character defects, seeks the friendship of A-4, but succeeds only in annoying A-4 and so fails of aer purpose **

1060.description: A, a young man of mediocre abilities, is happy in considering aerself a very superior person * A attempts audacious enterprises, but aer confidence has a way of leaving aer “flat” before the enterprises are carried through to completion **

1061.description: A is told by a clairvoyant that ae has inherited the trait of cowardice * A’s belief in the statement that ae has inherited the trait of cowardice, makes a coward of aer **

1062.description: A is so content with what ae has that any impulse toward enterprise is throttled

1063.description: A’s mistaken ideals are an obstacle to aer advancement * A’s ideal of labor is to do just enough to “get by” and hold aer job **
