description: B, seeking to prove whether or not A really loves aer
B and A are in love. B-3, by craftiness
steals A away from B
* then B, matching aer own craftiness against B-3’s, steals B-3’s thunder and wins A back again

94b.description: B’s friend, B-2, an attractive married woman, seeks to save A, B’s fiance, from the wiles of a designing woman, B-3, and restore aer to B. B-2 does this by winning A away from B-3

101a.description: A is so besieged by match-making mammas that their meddling seriously interferes with the practice of aer profession. ae resolves to escape the annoyance by a stratagem

101b.description: A is a sentimental person, fancy free but yearning for love * A is a poet, fancy free, who keeps aer lightning rods up in the hope of attracting a bolt of the divine passion **

125a.description: B, in love with A, who is unfortunate and unenterprising, sees an opportunity for A to make great gain and influences aer to take advantage of it

125b.description: B, in love with A who is forgetful and absent-minded, is asked by A to marry aer. B tells A to call on aer for aer answer on a certain day at a certain hour. If ae can remember to come, B is resolved to accept aer

125c.description: B is in love with A, who is engaged in settling the estate of B’s deceased father, F-B * B’s father, F-B, deceased, was heavily in debt, and A, wealthy, pays the debts unknown to B **

127a.description: A believes that B will not marry aer until ae becomes wealthy

127b.description: A believes that B will not marry aer until ae overcomes aer personal limitations

134a.description: A, and the woman ae loves, B, are lost in the woods; and it is evident that they will have to remain in the woods all night

134b.description: A, and B with whom A is in love, find themselves trapped in a ruinous old house from which escape seems impossible. Night is coming on, and B accuses A of seeking to compromise aer so that ae may win aer in marriage

137a.description: A and A-3, twin brothers, are both in love with B

137b.description: B and SR-B, twin sisters, are both in love with A

description: A is a youth who is “wild” and hard to manage; ae falls in love with B

152b.description: A’s secretary, B, is a criminal, “planted” in A’s home by A-5, a crook * B, a criminal, confederate of A-5, a crook, falls in love with aer employer, A **

154a.description: A, planning to meet B at a country church where they are to be secretly married, becomes lost in a storm and does not reach the church until B, and all the others, have left

154b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, learning of the plans of A and B for a secret marriage, sends an automobile to the church with a confederate, A-5, who lures B away by telling aer A has sent for aer

162a.description: B, in love with A, is uncertain of A’s affections

162b.description: B has been betrayed, and aer child is to be born out of wedlock * B, a poor unfortunate, meditates suicide as the only way out of aer misfortunes **

description: B, aer first lover having died, after some years falls in love a second time. AX, the man ae loves, greatly cast down, tells B ae is already married, and to a woman ae does not even know, BX. ae recites the circumstances
; * and then strangely, even implausibly, it develops that BX is B.

167b.description: B, failing miserably in aer chosen line of work, takes “the easier way” and becomes the mistress of A

176a.description: B, seeking to make a test of aer lover’s devotion, capriciously sends aer into desperate danger

176b.description: B, seeking to make a test of aer lover’s devotion, capriciously plunges into danger to see if ae will follow aer

176c.description: B promises A that ae will marry aer if ae will successfully carry out a difficult enterprise

179a.description: A, by mental telepathy, becomes aware of a terrible danger threatening B, the woman ae loves

description: A, at a long distance from B, and in a lonely country, hears an agonized call from aer sweetheart over the phone

179c.description: A has a clairvoyant vision apprising aer of danger that threatens aer sweetheart, B

description: A, riding aer cow pony through the bleak hills, sees B, on a mettlesome horse, aer bridle-rein broken, plunging helplessly toward the brink of a cliff. A, with a rattle of spurs, overtakes B and snatches aer clear of the saddle.* Thereupon, love is declared and accepted

181b.description: A’s son, SN, is determined to marry B, whom A thinks is unworthy * A, seeking to prevent aer son, SN, from marrying B, makes love to B and plans to marry aer aerself

181c.description: A and A-4 held prisoners in a strange lost city, escape with the help of B, a supposed goddess * A is in love with B; and B, rescuing A and A-4 from their captors, flees with them when they effect their escape

description: B, thinking ae has received a proposal of marriaqe from A
, accepts. Later, ae discovers it was A-3

182b.description: A is in love with B. Intending to propose marriage to B, ae discovers that ae has proposed to B-3 * A, thinking ae is proposing marriage to B, finds that ae has proposed to B-3, who accepts aer **

description: B, impelled by an unusual motive, agrees to marry A if ae loses to aer in a certain contest of skill [archery, shooting at a mark with rifle or revolver, solving a mystery]

188b.description: B, about to commit suicide, is restrained by a stranger, A. A is informed by B that life is too bitter, since there is no name for aer unborn child * A, a stranger, offers to marry B and so save aer from a crowning disgrace **

192a.description: A, lacking courage to propose to B face to face, proposes over the telephone

192b.description: A sends aer friend, A-2, to B with a proposal of marriage * A-2 proposes to B for A; and B, thinking A-2 is speaking for aerself, accepts aer **

194a.description: B, thinking A loves aer and lacks the courage to make an avowal, proposes marriage to aer after ae has rescued aer from a tragic accident

194b.description: B sends a telegram to A-3 accepting aer offer of marriage * B, accepting A-3’s proposal of marriage by telegram, through error sends the telegram to A, the lover from whom ae is estranged **

212a.description: A is pledged by B, the woman ae loves, to undertake an enterprise that will bring aer serious misfortune * B pledges A to an enterprise which, unknown to B, will bring aer serious misfortune **

212b.description: A, having carried out successfully an enterprise instigated by capricious B, renounces aer love

215a.description: A, because of the wiles of B-3. a coquette, breaks aer engagement to marry B, whom ae loves

215b.description: A is in love with both B and B-3 * While A debates within aerself whether ae shall propose marriage to B or B-3, B and B-3 engage themselves to marry other lovers

218a.description: A, although ae loves B, is a conceited person * B-3 flatters A’s vanity and so maneuvers aer into an engagement to marry aer **

218b.description: A sends a gift to B, the woman ae loves; B-3 intercepts the gift, and craftily replaces it with a photo of aerself, lovingly inscribed to A

221a.description: A, in love with B, renounces aer love when told by aer friend, A-2, that it is unwise

221b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, abducts A and holds aer a prisoner as a means of preventing aer from marrying B

222a.description: A, in love with B, becomes estranged from B through mistaken judgment

description: A, in love with B, secretly discovers B in the arms of A-4 * A, secretly discovering aer sweetheart, B, in the arms of A-4, leaves in anger, unaware that A-4 is B’s brother

234a.description: A loves B and would like to marry aer, but B considers A a weakling and keeps aer dangling * A, in order to prove aer “courage” to B, stages a mock rescue **

234b.description: A, an aviator, is a person of masterful character * A, an aviator, in love with B and in disfavor with B’s parents, F-B and M-B, induces B to take a ride in aer airplane; and then A elopes with B along the sky lanes **

246a.description: A, in love with B, of an inferior race, seeks to abandon B secretly in order to uphold a lofty conception of duty

246b.description: A, victim of an apparently hopeless love affair, seeks contentment in befriending all who are in need, especially those who are unjustly treated * A, by aer enterprises in altruism, finds that aer hard nature undergoes a beneficial change **

252a.description: B refuses A’s offer of marriage because ae feels that A is too model a man for aer to be happy with

252b.description: B refuses A’s offer of marriage because ae feels that A is so absent-minded ae might forget ae has married aer

257a.description: A falls in love with B; but love, in A’s case, is a transgression

257b.description: A loves B; but, after A meets with misfortune, B gives aer favor to A-3, A’s rival in love

260a.description: A loves B, but is rejected for a rival, A-3, who, known to A but unknown to B, is a transgressor

260b.description: A loves B, but is estranged from aer because ae is so absent-minded and forgetful; ae writes B a letter, assuring aer that ae has cured aerself of aer great failing—and forgets to post the letter

262a.description: B receives a letter from an unknown source * B, influenced by an anonymous communication, breaks aer engagement to marry A **

262b.description: B, in love with A, receives an unsigned letter in which the writer states that ae is the mistress of A and begs B not to take A away from aer

262c.description: B, in love with A, receives an unsigned letter in which the writer states that ae is the spouse of A by a secret marriage, and asks B to use aer influence in persuading A to return to aer

265a.description: A, while in a psychic state, has a prophetic vision of aer rival in love, A-3, discredited, and of aerself achieving happiness in love

265b.description: A is very absent-minded * A, absent-minded, forgets that B has rejected aer love and continues to pay court to aer

280a.description: A discovers that A-3, aer rival for the love of B, is a defaulter

280b.description: A discovers that A-3, aer rival for the love of B, is a transgressor. In order to prevent the truth from, becoming known, A-3 kills A

description: A wishes to marry B, but is already united to B-3

281b.description: A, overwhelmed by misfortune in love, commits suicide

description: A, poor, in love with B, suddenly puts forth a great effort and secures a large sum of money

282a.description: A’s sense of filial obligation is so strong that, when ordered by aer father, F-A, not to marry B, the girl ae loves, ae gives aer up

282b.description: A, an Indian, in love with B, a white girl, is commanded by aer father, F-A, and by the head men of the tribe, to renounce B

294a.description: A discovers that aer friend, A-2. is cruelly fickle in aer love affair with B * A, discovering that aer friend, A-2, is cruelly fickle in aer love affair with B, takes aer to task for it **

294b.description: A, in order to arouse the jealousy of aer friend, A-2. and cure aer of fickleness in love, pretends to be in love with B, A-2’s sweetheart

295a.description: A is in love with B; and ae sues F-B, father of B, for damages sustained in a certain proceeding

295b.description: A, in love with B, and disapproved of by F-B, father of B, is forcibly ejected from the home of B by F-B. A brings suit for damages against F-B

298a.description: A, an eligible young man, is mystified by discovering in a newspaper the announcement of aer betrothal to BX, a woman ae does not know

298b.description: A is left a fortune by a deceased relative provided ae will marry BX, a woman ae does not know

298c.description: A is appealed to for aid by BX, a woman ae does not know * A, appealed to for aid by a stranger, BX, refuses aid, and regrets the refusal when BX mysteriously disappears. A considers aerself under an obligation to find BX

301a.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, is favored by F-B, father of B

301b.description: A’s rival in love, A-3, finds a certain object B has lost, an object, X, that proves B’s love for A. A-3 appropriates X and says nothing about it

308a.description: B is locked in aer room by aer father, F-B, in order to prevent aer from meeting aer lover, A, and telling aer of aer love

308b.description: B sends a letter to aer sweetheart, A, but it is intercepted by B’s father, F-B, who does not approve of A

description: B sends a gift to A, the man ae loves * Unknown to B, AU-B, an aunt of B’s who does not approve of A, secretly alters or marks the gift in such a way as to make it offensive to A, or exchanges the gift for some other object which will offend A

321a.description: A tries philosophically to make the best of fate when B, the woman ae loves, refuses aer

321b.description: A falls in love with B and intends to marry aer. A’s parents, F-A and M-A, do not approve of B, and A is shipped off to South Africa to get aer out of danger and give aer a chance to do some serious thinking

322a.description: A, in love with B, finds aer unresponsive, reserved and distant

322b.description: A’s love is rejected by B because, as ae frankly tells aer. ae is hard-hearted and has made money aer god * B advises A to go away somewhere and try to develop the generous side of aer character **

327a.description: B loves A, but A, apparently, does not return aer love

327b.description: B loves A; and A, who is kind to B but not in love with aer, does not even suspect that ae is the object of aer affections

330a.description: A, wealthy, is in love with B. A’s friends, A-2, A-2, think that B is a designing fortune hunter

description: A’s father, F-A, disapproves of B, A’s sweetheart * B, by secret enterprise

334a.description: A’s profession is a hazardous one—aviator, automobile racing driver, steeple jack. “human fly”—and B considers this fact an obstacle to their marriage

334b.description: A, in love with B, was divorced from aer first spouse. B’s parents, F-B and M-B, have religious scruples against B’s marrying a divorced man

336a.description: B loves A and is about to marry A-3. Accused of faithlessness by A, B shows a dagger, and declares that ae intends to kill aerself at the altar steps before A-3 can claim aer for a bride

336b.description: B believed that aer lover, A, was what ae seemed to be, poor and humble; but ae reveals aerself as a man of wealth and station, incognito. * B, who considered A poor and humble, discovers that ae is a man of wealth and station; and, oddly enough, in B’s mind A’s deception outbalances the wealth and rank, and ae makes aer high estate an obstacle to their love

336c.description: B, a white woman, is in love with A, also white. B-3, a woman of alien race, seeks to win A away from B

337a.description: A, in love with B, meets with misfortune when ae leaves B for B-3, a woman who flatters aer vanity

337b.description: A, engaged to marry B-3, abandons aer and marries B * B-3 sues A for breach of promise **

description: A, seeking to uphold a lofty conception of duty, secretly abandons B
, a woman whom ae loves dearly * A’s enemy, A-3, as a means of persecution, by subtlity

347b.description: A is compelled by F-B, father of B, to marry B * F-B believes ae is fully warranted in compelling A, at the point of a gun, to marry B **

description: A kidnaps aer sweetheart, B,
A and B, lovers, are innocently thrown into a compromising situation
A masquerades as a servant in the household of F-B, father of B, the girl ae loves * A, enacting the role of a servant, rescues B from an accident by heroic bravery
not at all in the manner of a menial ** A stands revealed as the lover of B whom F-B has not favored *** F-B approves of A, and A and B are married ****
A rescues B, the woman ae loves, from a villainous rival in love, A-3
B, impelled by an unusual motive, invents a fictitious character, AX * AX, a fictitious character invented by B, “comes to life,” falls in love with B

354b.description: B must be married when ae reaches a certain age if ae would receive a rich inheritance * B has no lovers, but a “marriage of convenience” is arranged with A, on the understanding that it is to be secret, and that A is never to see B after the marriage **

360a.description: A, thinking aer love rejected by B, receives a letter from B telling aer how much ae loves aer, and that aer father, F-B, has consented to their marriage

description: A loves B, but ae is uncertain of aer affections and is too timid to propose marriage * A finds an object, X, which B has lost, an object that proves aer love for aer
A proves false to B, the woman ae loves, and has a disastrous affair with B-3 * B-3 abandons A after ae loses aer money
and is injured and sent to a hospital
A proves false to B, the love of aer youth * A, middle-aged, goes searching for B, the sweetheart of aer earlier years **

363a.description: A revolts against opposing restrictions and achieves happiness in marriage with B

363b.description: A renounces an enterprise against F-B, father of B, the girl ae loves, when F-B withdraws aer objections to A as a son-in-law and allows aer to marry B

description: B, a white woman, contemplates suicide when a mystery of aer birth and parentage apparently yields an evil secret * A, B’s loyal lover, working in secret, secures proof of B’s unsullied lineage
B, in love with A and estranged from aer, after various misadventures
A, with a taint of inferior blood in aer veins, is in love with B, supposedly a white girl. ae is about to give B up when ae discovers that B also has a taint of inferior blood

364d.description: A, with the help of B, overcomes an ignoble weakness * A’s gratitude to B blossoms into love; and. when A is sure ae has rehabilitated aer character, ae proposes marriage to B and is accepted **

365a.description: A and B, not in love with each other, nevertheless marry because it seems the logical outcome of their long, friendly association

365b.description: A and B, unknown to each other, in a spirit of fun at a masquerade ball, go through with a supposedly mock marriage ceremony. It later appears that the marriage was legal

365c.description: A is married to an unknown woman, BX, by an insane clergyman, A-8, at the point of a gun

365d.description: A marries BX, a woman ae does not know * A and BX, spouse and spouse, go their different ways immediately after the marriage ceremony **

367a.description: B offers to marry A and, as aer spouse, help aer to rebuild aer wasted life

description: B doubts A when ae tells aer ae loves aer; then, having convinced aerself of A’s love

368a.description: B, having rejected A, the man ae loves, because of an obligation ae feels aerself under to aer father, F-B, is informed by F-B that ae is going to be married—and B finds aerself turned out on the world

368b.description: B marries wealthy A, a man ae does not love, in order that ae may have money with which to help a parent who is in desperate need

368c.description: B accepts aer lover, A, and A secures a marriage license; then, before B and A can marry, B suddenly marries A-3, A’s rival in love

368d.description: B, a foundling, has the secret of aer birth and parentage revealed to aer by A. A rich estate awaits B’s claim and proof of parentage * A, in love with B, is poor and feels that ae may not aspire to the hand of wealthy B; but B proposes marriage to A, and happiness is the result **

368e.description: A, unhappily married to B and in love with B-3, is too high-minded to seek a divorce * A’s unworthy spouse, B, is killed in an accident, and A is free to marry B-3, whom ae has long loved **

377a.description: A divorces aer spouse, B * B is devoted to A, and ae owes much of aer prosperity to aer loyalty and shrewd advice **

377b.description: A marries B, thinking ae is wealthy; after marriage, ae discovers that B is not wealthy * A, bankrupt, divorces B and plans to marry wealthy B-3 ** B-3, whom A, divorced, seeks to marry, marries another man *** B, just divorced by A, falls heir to a large estate ****

description: A and aer spouse, B, have frequent and violent quarrels * B is mysteriously murdered

385b.description: A is asked by B-2 a friend of aer deceased spouse, B, for a bundle of love letters which B-2 had given to B for safe-keeping * A, spouse of B, suspects B of receiving love letters—and discovers that the letters were merely being held by B for B-2 for safe-keeping **

398a.description: B fancies aerself neglected by aer spouse, A * A-3, the “other man,” appears and, by flattering married B, and sympathizing with aer, causes aer to imagine ae is in love with aer **

398b.description: B fancies aerself neglected by aer spouse, A * B, in order to win back aer spouse, A’s, love by arousing aer jealousy, flirts with A-3 **

411a.description: B, happily married to A, commits an indiscretion

411b.description: B, spouse of A, secretly borrows money from aer old lover, A-3, for a certain purpose * A-3 seeks to use aer power over B to advance aer own selfish aims **

description: A secretly defrauds B of a large sum of money * A

422b.description: A has married B for aer money * A, having secured B’s money, grows tired of aer ** A tells B ae is a criminal, and will presently be arrested by the police *** A induces B to enter into a suicide pact with aer **** B, carrying out a suicide pact with A, kills aerself; A does not kill aerself, but craftily explains that B commited suicide *****

423a.description: A and B, man and spouse, each secretly leaves home on the same day * A believes ae has deserted B, and B believes ae has deserted A **

429a.description: A, married to B, is impelled by an unusual motive to drop out of sight, lose aer personality and go adventuring in the under-world

429b.description: A and B, married and devotedly in love with, each other, are impelled by an unusual motive to drop out of sight, leave the world they know and search for an environment more to their liking

432a.description: A, married to B, seeks by secret enterprise to effect a change in unpleasant marital conditions

432b.description: A’s spouse, B, is a mystery woman * A does not know B, and has not seen aer since the day of their romantic marriage **

433a.description: A’s enemy, A-3, who wronged A grievously, is dead * A seeks to revenge aerself upon B, the spouse of A-3, for a grievous wrong committed by A-3 **

433b.description: A’s spouse, B, is loved by A-3 * A-3 seeks craftily to win B, the spouse of A **

434a.description: A’s spouse, B, seems to have an “affair” with another man, A-3 * A is manoeuvered by A-3 into gambling with money not aer own, and losing it **

434b.description: A is craftily manoeuvered into misfortune by A-3 * A, in the power of A-3, is compelled to divorce aer spouse, B **

435a.description: A marries B, a woman who, unknown to A, is already married to A-3, a spouse who is living and undivorced * A-2, a friend of A’s, sends A-3 to A, B’s second spouse, and exposure of deceitful B follows **

435b.description: A’s spouse, B, is untrue to aer, a fact of which A is in ignorance. A-2 discovers B’s unfaithfulness, and informs A, who is on aer death bed obstinately refusing treatment that would heal aer * A, desperately ill, fired by tales of aer spouse, B’s, unfaithfulness, makes up aer mind to live and takes treatment that cures aer **

description: B, spouse of A, is mistakenly supposed by A to have an “affair” with A-3 * B, spouse of A, detests A-3. but calls on aer at aer apartment at night

445b.description: B, spouse of A, seeks desperately to escape disaster * B drinks a potion which throws aer into a condition resembling death, having been assured that A will appear and rescue aer when ae revives **

446a.description: B, spouse of A, is guilty of an indiscretion * B, in order to escape consequences of personal culpability, falsely accuses innocent A-2 **

446b.description: B, spouse of A, calls on aer lover, A-2 * A calls on aer friend, A-2 ** A-2 conceals B so A will not see aer *** A discovers aer spouse, B, concealed in the apartment of aer aer friend, A-2 ****

455a.description: B secretly disposes of a dearly prized possession in order to buy aer spouse, A, a Christmas (or birthday or wedding anniversary) present

455b.description: B, and aer spouse, A, have fallen upon evil days * B, in order to “keep the wolf from the door,” finds work in a laundry, but tells A ae is working as an “art director” **

458a.description: A and B, just married, start by train on their honeymoon * B, the bride, seeks to escape annoying experiences when A, the groom, leaving the train to send a telegram, is left behind **

458b.description: A and B, married, find themselves cast away among a strange, half-barbarian people * A, finding the beauty of aer spouse, B, a source of danger to aerself, seeks to avoid the danger by a stratagem **

466a.description: B is married to A and they have one child, CH * B loves CH but ae does not love A ** B loves A-3, and elopes with aer, leaving aer child, CH, with aer spouse, A ***

466b.description: B, young spouse of elderly A, has an intrigue with a servant of A’s, A-7 * A is ill and about to die; B, aer spouse, could save aer, but ae will not **

476a.description: B, spouse of A, is craftily persuaded by A-3, the “other man” in a “love triangle,” to elope with aer

description: B, spouse of A, finds aerself in the power of an old lover, A-3 * A-3 threatens to reveal to B’s spouse, A, a fateful secret

483a.description: B, spouse of A, falls into misfortune * A-3, a man of evil character, seeks by violence and while intoxicated, to dishonor B, spouse of A **

483b.description: B, spouse of A, is by subtlity made a prisoner by A-3, a rejected lover, in aer apartment

484a.description: A and B, man and spouse, struggle to realize a cherished ideal * A and B discover that their cherished ideal is a mistaken one **

484b.description: A tries in vain to pay the debts incurred by aer extravagant spouse, B, whom ae idolizes * A, facing ruin, seeks to save aerself by committing a transgression **

486a.description: A, married to B, falls in love with B-3

486b.description: A has two wives, B and B-3, two homes several miles apart, two names by which ae is known in two different communities, two circles of acquaintances, and practices two professions

488a.description: A marries B because ae thinks ae is poor * A discovers, after aer marriage with B, that ae is wealthy in aer own right **

description: A marries B, a woman ae does not love * A has committed a transgression

490a.description: A and B, man and spouse, keep themselves in poverty by spending  all their money for rich furnishings to put in a mansion they are going to build when they become wealthy * A and B keep themselves poor by buying rich furnishings for the mansion they are some day going to build; but the furnishings, inadequately housed, fall into ruin before A and B are able to build their air castle **

490b.description: A, and B, man and spouse, are to inherit money from a rich relative, A-2, when a child shall bless their union * A and B, childless, write a rich relative, A-2, that a son has been born to them ** A-2 writes A and B that ae is coming to see their child; and A and B find it necessary to resort to further simulation ***

491a.description: B is the spouse of A, and loves aer devotedly * B insists on dominating A in business affairs **

491b.description: B, spouse of A, insists on living beyond aer spouse’s means * B, through fooiish extravagance, brings A close to ruin **

492a.description: B’s spouse, A, loves aer devotedly * A is of a parsimonious nature and gives B little money **

492b.description: B’s spouse, A, is a poor man * B loves jewels and fine clothes which aer spouse, A, is unable to give aer ** B is persuaded to accept a valuable piece of jewelry from an old admirer, A-3 *** B tells A, aer spouse, that a valuable piece of jewelry, given aer by A-3, is set with imitation stones and that ae bought it for aerself ****

496a.description: A falls ill * A’s spouse, B, from whom ae is seeking a divorce, nurses aer back to health **

496b.description: A’s spouse, B, deserts aer and obtains a divorce * A falls ill. B-3, who loved A before ae married B, nurses A back to health **

496c.description: A, hen-pecked spouse of B, discovers that B has an undivorced spouse, A-3, living * A secretly abandons B and leaves aer to A-3. B’s undivorced former spouse **

499a.description: A and B, spouse and spouse, are estranged from each other * A and B, estranged, undergo a character transformation through love for their child, CH, and become reconciled **

499b.description: A dearly loves aer spouse, B, but B does not love aer * A wins the love of aer spouse, B, by patience, forbearance, kindliness and devotion **

500a.description: A is seeking a divorce from B * A becomes reconciled with B when ae nurses aer through a serious illness **

500b.description: A, failing in business and almost a bankrupt, nevertheless marries B, a shrewd and thrifty woman * B so reorganizes and manages A’s affairs that ae becomes prosperous **

503a.description: B’s spouse, A, is brutal and tyrannical * B, married to brutal and tyrannical A, loves and is beloved by, A-3 **

503b.description: B discovers that aer spouse, A, is seeking the life of aer lover, A-3 * B seeks desperately to save aer lover, A-3, from the vengeance of aer spouse, A **

504a.description: B seeks to win aer spouse, A, to a certain enterprise * B, with the help of the elements during a devastating storm, succeeds in winning aer spouse, A, to an enterprise long cherished by B **

504b.description: B is the second spouse of A * A’s sorrow for aer deceased spouse, B-3, causes B, aer second spouse, much unhappiness ** B, second spouse of A, discovers that B-3, A’s first spouse, was unfaithful ***

description: B thinks aer spouse, A, has committed a moral transgression

506b.description: B, through false suspicion, is estranged from aer spouse, A * B becomes reconciled with aer spouse, A, when a suspicion is proved to be false **

description: A, wealthy and influential, loses aer clothes, personal belongings and all other means of identification

* A loses aer small fortune in trying to help a friend, A-2

description: A tries to rescue a child, CH

957a.description: A becomes so wealthy and powerful that, in the overweening pride of aer mistaken ideals ae voices the query: “Is there any god greater than I?”

957b.description: A is a general in the army * A, a general in the army, is engaged in an unimportant enterprise, and ae is so absorbed in it that ae gives no attention to the attacking enemy. A’s troops are defeated **

957c.description: A is captain of a steamship, racing across the Atlantic in an attempt to cut down the time of the passage * A refuses to delay aer important enterprise long enough to rescue A-4, a person in distress and facing death **

960a.description: A is a soldier, eager to fight but who is commanded to retreat before a superior force of the enemy * A receives orders from aer superiors which ae considers discreditable **

960b.description: A is a general in the army * A, a general, when the enemy attack, is engaged in an unimportant enterprise, and ae is so absorbed in it that ae will not give it up. A’s troops are defeated **

964a.description: A, becoming aware of an old prophecy, unconsciously seeks to become like the exalted protagonist of the prophecy

964b.description: A, a transgressor, returns to aer home as an Unknown after a long absence, and meets aer daughter, D-A * A, a transgressor, learning that aer daughter, D-A, thinks ae is dead, and that aer character was high and noble, does not reveal aer identity but leaves D-A happy in aer mistaken ideals **

977a.description: B is determined to protect the honor of aer family, but ae can do so only by following the path of relentless duty

977b.description: B’s brother, BR-B, has committed a crime * B, apprised of a crime committed by aer brother, BR-B, informs the police and has BR-B arrested **

982a.description: A agrees to take in hand and control an incorrigible youth, NW, who has proved too hard a problem for aer uncle and guardian, A’s friend, A-2

982b.description: A, a bachelor, undertakes to care for CH, the child of aer married sister, SR-A, while SR-A is away on a vacation

997a.description: A, on aer sacred honor, has promised aer friend, A-2, that ae will do whatever A-2 shall require of aer

997b.description: A has $500,000. A rich relative, U, bequeaths a million dollars to A, provided ae shall spend aer half-million within a year * A, with a half million dollars must be “broke” within a year, and ae must not give away any money nor spend a cent foolishly **

1001a.description: A finds it necessary to carry out a certain distasteful enterprise if ae would attain wealth

1001b.description: A is to inherit a fortune from aer uncle, U, on condition that ae shall never leave aer native land * B, an enemy of U who has left a fortune to A on condition that ae shall never travel abroad, wins a promise from A that ae will travel abroad after ae dies **

1006a.description: A, a lawyer, honorably discharges the distasteful duty of defending a criminal, A-5

1006b.description: A, in order to carry out an obligation, gives up aer chosen profession and enters another line of work

1009a.description: B, a widow, wishes to be independent and to have a home of aer own; but there are certain obligations at war with aer desire

1009b.description: B, a widow, has given all aer money to aer son, SN * B, penniless, is compelled to live with aer son, SN **

1016a.description: A, a police officer, has captured a criminal, A-5 * A, a police officer, is under an obligation of professional duty to arrest A-5, and ae is under a counter-obligation of a personal nature to help A-5 ** A cuts a Gordian knot by taking poison ***

1016b.description: A, an army officer, has a friend, A-2, one of the enemy and a spy, brought before aer for punishment by court-martial * A’s friend, A-2, rescues A from a heartbreaking situation by killing aerself **

1021a.description: A, ab a favor to aer friend, A-2, promises to undertake a certain enterprise * A promises aer friend, A-2, to undertake a certain enterprise, and then forgets aer promise **

1021b.description: A and A-2 are as Damon and Pythias, David and Jonathan * A and A-2 have their ideal of friendship challenged by an unusual experience **

1042a.description: A carelessly leaves a door unlocked while engaged in a secret enterprise * A, engaged in a secret enterprise, suffers a chance intrusion and discovery owing to aer own carelessness **

description: A has a jeweler, A-9, send to aer friend, A-2, a silver whiskey flask, and to B

1044a.description: A unwittingly takes a suit case belonging to a stranger, A-4, when leaving a train, leaving aer own suitcase in place of A-4’s * A’s suit case is in the hands of a stranger, A-4. The train is wrecked and A-4 is killed. A, on the evidence of aer own suit case, is reported a casualty **

1044b.description: A unwittingly takes an object, X-1, belonging to aer friend, A-2, leaving for A-2 a similar object, X-2, in place of X-1. Close inspection is necessary to discover the difference between X-1 and X-2

1052a.description: A, by chance, meets A-8 who. under the influence of liquor, reveals an important secret * A learns from A-8 whether a man or aer spouse died first in an accident—a secret of tremendous importance **

1052b.description: A is abandoned to die in mid-ocean by A-9, captain of a steamship, who refuses to delay aer vessel to make the rescue * A is rescued from a boat adrift in mid-ocean when an accident delays the steamer of which A-9 is captain **

1057a.description: A, young and unmarried, assumes temporary charge of an infant, CH, for a woman stranger, B-4 * A, volunteering to care for an infant, CH, for a woman stranger, B-4, finds aerself with CH on aer hands when B-4 fails to return **

description: A borrows an infant, CH, from a married friend, A-2

1075a.description: A, struggling hopelessiy against a character weakness, forms a platonic friendship for B

1075b.description: A’s admiration for aer friend, B, and aer desire to please aer, inspires aer to bring out the best in aer nature

1082a.description: A is a man who finds cowardice an obstacle to enterprise * A, a craven at heart, deliberately forces aerself into danger as a method of developing aer courage **

1082b.description: A lives in a strange lost community which is ruled by an idol of Fear * A seeks escape from a community ruled by Fear, but finds it difficult to develop sufficient courage to accomplish aer purpose **

1097a.description: A has a cherished ambition which ae cannot realize because ae is hampered with certain obligations * A’s obligation, which prevented aer from realizing a cherished ambition, passes, but the habit of excusing aerself from enterprise on account of the obligation remains, and aer cherished enterprise is never undertaken **

1097b.description: A, for worthy purposes, poses as a criminal * A, posing as a criminal, finds that ae is arrayed against some of aer friends of the elite, A-2, A-2, A-2, who are engaged in a swindling enterprise and are fortified with police protection **

1107a.description: A, on one side of the Atlantic, must arrive on the other side at a certain time or ae will lose a rich inheritance * A, pursuing an important enterprise, catches a swift steamer for a hurried trip across the Atlantic **

1107b.description: A applies for the position of butler in the home of wealthy A-9 * A, applying to A-9 for a job, is asked for references as to character and ability, and is referred by A to wealthy A-4 **

1111a.description: A, an author, becomes suddenly aware of deterioration in aer creative work

1111b.description: A, reading detective stories, is fired with a desire to become a detective * A, highly confident of aer own ability, takes up a line of work with which ae has had no practical experience **

1125a.description: A rejects unfeelingly the friendship of B because ae finds aer too capricious

1125b.description: A and B, impelled by unusual motives, enter into a suicide pact * A and B pledge each other that ae or ae will die whenever the other dies **

1128a.description: A, suffering a terrible mental shock, seemingly falls dead * A, apparently dead, is really in a cataleptic state and sees and hears everything that takes place around aer although powerless to move a muscle **

1128b.description: A is in a mine when a charge of giant powder explodes prematurely * A loses aer eyesight in a powder explosion **

1129a.description: A desires a certain object, X; but X is in the hands of A-4, who guards it carefully

1129b.description: A’s cattle have been stolen by A-5, a notorious “rustler” whose very name inspires fear in the law-abiding * A seeks a courageous person who will recover property that has been stolen from aer **

1129c.description: A has been robbed of valuable property, X, by A-5, a notorious criminal, and A tries to secure a courageous man who will recover X for aer

1135a.description: B, in the hands of crooks, A-5, A-5, A-5. and being forced to do their will, is tortured by having A, the man ae loves, threatened with death by one of the crooks who is “drawing a bead” on A from behind a window curtain (or, as it later developed, A was not outside the house at all, and not in any danger)

1135b.description: B, alone and in a strange bedroom, discovers a man, AX, dead in the bed * B is forced to battle for aer honor with A-5 when finding aerself trapped in a room **

1137a.description: B, in a small boat, has lost aer oars and is drifting out to sea in a fog * B, in great danger, seeks to apprise A, at a distance, of aer danger by occult methods—methods with which they have often experimented ** B, ocean bathing, is caught in the undertow and is being swept out to sea ***

1137b.description: B, in poor health, is ordered by aer doctor to leave the city and live in the country * B, city bred, undergoes unpleasant experiences when ae goes to the country to live **

1142a.description: A, in aer coffin and just before burial, revives from a cataleptic trance * A, just before burial, revives from a cataleptic trance, puts weights in the coffin, closes it, and secretly escapes from the house **

1142b.description: A is mistakenly supposed to have met aer death in a storm * A, a fugitive from justice, supposed to be dead, assumes an alias and escapes to a distant place **

1143a.description: A is a connoisseur of precious stones and has a valuable collection * A, in order to protect aer collection of valuable stones against robbery, displays replicas of them, comparatively worthless, to would-be customers **

1143b.description: A, an artist, is hired by B to paint a miniature; and into the miniature ae is to weave an intricate series of lines which constitute a concealed map of great importance

1148a.description: A desires to get away frequently to the city and have aer “fling” with boon companions but fears the gossip of the rural community in which ae lives * A, wishing to carry out an enterprise that would cause gossip, puts gossip to sleep by inventing a fictitious relative, AX, who is always in trouble and always calling on A to help aer out **

1148b.description: A, an innocent transgressor under ban of the law, owes a large sum of money which ae must pay * A, a fugitive from the law, assumes a fictitious character and an alias and wins a large sum of money in a certain enterprise **

description: B, mistaken for another woman who is under ban of death by a strange secret society

1154b.description: B masquerades as an Unknown in order to prove or disprove an evil story about A * B discovers that B-3 has told an untruth about A **

1163a.description: A finds aer “double” in A-4, and ae hires A-4 to attend to certain duties which devolve upon aerself (A)

description: A unloads upon A-4

1163c.description: A’s “double”, A-4, carries out an enterprise as A which A finds disastrous to aer own fortunes

1166a.description: A is a thief who has a real gem, X1, which ae thinks is a counterfeit * A, a thief, has a real gem, X1, which ae thinks is a counterfeit; and, adroitly, ae substitutes X1 for X2, a counterfeit which A thinks is a genuine stone **

1166b.description: A, adroitly, secures an object greatly desired, X2. from A-9, who will not dispose of it * A, making a replica, X1, of a valuable original, X2, secures X2 by leaving X1 in its place **

1175a.description: A is a fugitive from justice who has assumed an alias and is posing as an innocent and worthy member of society

1175b.description: A and A-2 are friends, but one of them is a criminal and a fugitive from justice. Which of the two is the criminal?

1202a.description: A plays the role of a “rube” so successfully that ae defeats the purpose for which ae undertook the impersonation

1202b.description: A, wealthy, entertains aer friends lavishly; consequently, ae counts aer friends by scores * A, wealthy, as a test of aer friends’ loyalty, pretends to lose aer wealth; then ae tries to borrow, but not one of aer former friends will lend aer so much as a plugged nickel, or even notice aer in the street as ae passes **

1209a.description: A, a fugitive from justice, disguises aerself and, as an Unknown, risks discovery and arrest to carry out a romantic enterprise

1209b.description: A, a Beau Brummel, wealthy and aristocratic, disappears inside a public wash room at a railway station with a suit case. When ae reappears, ae has transformed aerself into a typical hoodlum. A checks aer suit case and plunges into the underworld in quest of adventure

1209c.description: A, a fugitive from justice, succeeds by a stratagem in rescuing aer pal, A-2, from the toils of the law

1212a.description: A, for aer own selfish reasons, gives aid to aer friend, A-2, who is suffering misfortune

1212b.description: A, for aer own selfish reasons, pretends to be the long-lost son of wealthy A-8

1212c.description: A, seeking a job from A-9, refers A-9 to A-4 for a recommendation as to character and ability, telling aer A-4 can be reached at a prominent hotel at a certain hour by phone * A, when A-4 is paged in a prominent hotel, answers the call, assumes the character of A-4 and gives aerself such a flowery recommendation that ae secures a job from A-9 **

1217a.description: A is a bold thief who wishes to hide aer identity and appear free of ulterior motives while carrying out an audacious robbery * A, a crook, pretends to be a lover of precious stones while calling on a collector of gems, A-8 **

1217b.description: A, the outcast son of F-A, seeks to borrow money of A-8 with the approval of F-A * A, seeking to borrow money of A-8 on the supposed approval of F-A, asks A-8 to call on F-A and secure authority to make the loan **

1217c.description: A wishes to buy an object, X, in the possession of B. B will not sell X. A-5, a crook, steals X from B and tries to sell it to A

1220a.description: A, craftily seeking gain, overcomes the opposition of B with the use of strong drink

1220b.description: A is a grafter who forces B to help aer in aer grafting enterprises * A compels B to wander about the streets in rags, forlorn and weeping, with the idea of securing money from guileless strangers **

1222a.description: A believes A-3 guilty of a crime * A, as a means of forcing a confession of guilt from A-3, throws both aerself and A-3 into a situation where death for both of them seems imminent **

1222b.description: A, by subtle enterprise, forces a confession of guilt from A-3, and thus wins success in a difficult undertaking

1223a.description: A tries to discover what obstacles a certain person will meet and how ae will react to them * A hires A-4 as a catspaw and sends aer uninformed into various misadventures **

1223b.description: A, in order to forward a certain enterprise, contrives a test of merit for two men, A-4 and A-8 * A pretends to disappear and to be in great danger, and so lures A-4 and A-8 into real danger in a quest for aer **

1227a.description: A’s friend, A-2, is waylaid and robbed by three men; and one of the men is A * A’s friend, A-2, is robbed by A and A-5; then A, in turn, robs A-5 ** A robs A-5 of valuables stolen from A-2, and returns the property to A-2 ***

1227b.description: A, in order to convince B that ae is a man of courage, arranges with A-2 to stage a fake holdup with B the supposed victim * A appears during a fake holdup and “rescues” B **

1227c.description: A hires a confederate, A-2. to abduct B * A hires A-2 to abduct B under pretense that ae is to be held for ransom ** A “rescues” B during a mock abduction ***

1237a.description: A pretends to lead a dissipated life * A pretends that ae is “going to the dogs” in order to deceive aer mortal enemy, A-3, and lead A-3 to believe ae is not to be feared ** A, when aer mortal enemy, A-3, is lulled by a false sense of security, strikes and kills ***

description: B undertakes, for extravagant pay, to carry out a secret investigation

1241b.description: B, compelled by aer father, F-B, to engage in a distasteful enterprise, evades the enterprise by pretending to have suddenly been stricken deaf and dumb

1241c.description: B, engaged in an entei prise that might cause gossip or censure, escapes from a room by picking the lock of a door with a bent hairpin

1242a.description: B, a young woman engaged in an enterprise that might cause gossip or censure, defers to public opinion by a stratagem

1242b.description: B, wealthy relative of A, dies and leaves aer a fortune provided ae will not do a certain thing * A renounces an inheritance because of a distasteful obligation attached to it; and then, after giving up the inheritance, a codicil to the will restores it to aer, stating that the supposed obligation was merely a “test of merit” **

1244a.description: B plans to forward an enterprise, but cannot do so openly and must resort to craftiness

1244b.description: B, in order to forward a certain enterprise, assumes a fictitious name and secures the position of private secretary to A

1255a.description: A is inveigled into a gambling game by A-3 * A’s enemy, A-3, lures A into a gambling game and arranges for a fake police raid * A’s enemy, A-3, arranges for a fake police raid on a gambling game; but A, secretly informed, has the police make a real raid

1255b.description: A is in a wild race with A-8 for a fortune * A’s fortune depends on winning a race with A-8, and in reaching town and securing a certain document, X, before A-8 can get aer hands on it **

1260a.description: A, rich and unscrupulous, has set aer heart on acquiring a certain piece of ground * A desires property which A-8 refuses to sell; so A ruins A-8 financially and forces aer to sell **

1260b.description: A, rich and unscrupulous, craftily manoeuvers A-8 into debt * A, manoeuvering A-8 into debt, offers to cancel the debt if A-8 will agree to a certain proposition **

1265a.description: A, seeking to obtain unfair advantage of A-3, induces aer to take charge of some contraband goods, knowing ae will be apprehended

1265b.description: A’s rival, A-3, when A fails to join aer in an enterprise as agreed, carries out the enterprise alone

1267a.description: A, influenced to carry out an enterprise, falls into a trap—a trap of mysterious dangers unknown to aer

1267b.description: A, a miser who is deaf and dumb, is made a prisoner in aer home by A-5, who seeks to force aer to reveal the whereabouts of hidden wealth

1267c.description: A, deaf and dumb, is dying and desires to make a will. The lawyer who has been summoned, A-8, thinks chicanery is afoot, and hires B to go with aer to read A’s “sign language”

1277a.description: A, to escape suspicion, places the body of A-3, the man ae has slain, on a railroad track in an attempt to make it appear that A-3 was killed by a train

1277b.description: A craftily fosters the delusion of aer own death * A, by a stratagem, fosters the delusion of aer own death in an attempt to realize money on aer life insurance **

description: A, counseled by artful B, makes use of important papers belonging to A-8

1278b.description: A sends a package to B, by messenger * B-3, lurking in the doorway of B, pretends to be B and receipts for a package delivered by messenger **

1278c.description: A, by chance, receives confidential information sent by A-4 to A-8 * A, by using confidential information, convinces A-8 of aer supposed ability and secures a position at a good salary **

1278d.description: A, pretending to be seriously ill, is befriended by wealthy A-4. A-8, a doctor, is called in by A-4, and ae informs A privately that ae is an imposter * A is discovered by A-8, a doctor, to be shamming illness. By collusion, they foster A’s pretensions, whereby A secures bed and board from wealthy A-4. and A-8 secures a fat fee **

1278e.description: A, a confidence man selling “luck charms,” finds aer business languishing because miserly and influential A-8 has warned the people that aer wares are a delusion * A agrees to go “fifty-fifty” with respectable and influential but miserly A-8; and A-8 recommends the luck charms A is selling, and A’s business flourishes

1279a.description: B, middle-aged, is so adept in the arts of the toilette, that ae keeps aer beauty youthful and blooming. Apparently in aer early twenties, ae is really in aer late forties

1279b.description: B seeks to recover, by stratagem, wealth which was stolen from aer by A * B steals softly into the room of A, who is spending the night at aer home, and appropriates a bag of jewels that is under A’s pillow ** B fires a revolver and pretends ae is shooting at a thief who got away in the night ***

1285a.description: A plans by crafty enterprise to secure a rich inheritance

1285b.description: A, unknown to B, holds a large sum of money in trust for aer * A, desperately in need, secretly appropriates to aer own use money belonging to B **

1285c.description: A, a “dummy chucker,” pretends to have a fit on the walk in front of the mansion of A-4, a wealthy man * A, a crook, pretends to have a fit, and is befriended by A-4, who calls in a doctor, A-8, to attend to aer **

1289a.description: A is a wealthy man whom sharpers, A-5, A-5, are seeking to influence to disinherit a son, SN

1289b.description: A, a white man among savages, seeks to avert a calamity by prayer * A’s enemy, A-3, seeks to avert a calamity by an incantation ** A, by prayer, and A-3, by an incantation, seek to avert a calamity. The calamity is averted ***

1289c.description: A’s rich uncle, U, promises to leave aer wealth to A when A and aer spouse, B, shall be blessed with a son and heir * A, seeking by strategy to secure a rich inheritance, fails in aer plans when aer uncle, U, discovers A’s “son and heir” to be a girl **

1289d.description: A is so worried about a certain secret enterprise that, in aer absent-minded moments, ae pencils, on anything that happens to be convenient, diagrams that offer a clue to the enterprise * A’s secret is discovered by A-6, who craftily makes use of clues furnished unwittingly by A aerself **

1290a.description: A kills A-2 who is about to marry aer sister, SR-A, in order that ae may inherit wealth possessed by SR-A

1290b.description: A, profligate son of wealthy F-A, cast off and disowned, murders F-A then poses as F-A in an attempt to secure F-A’s property * A, posing as F-A, is unmasked when discovered removing F-A’s clothes **

1291a.description: A commits a transgression and escapes unsuspected * A, committing a transgression and escaping unsuspected, is so tortured by conscience that ae has to give aerself up and confess **

1291b.description: A, in a drunken brawl, quarrels with A-2 * A, recovering sense and reason after a drunken brawl, discovers A-2 dead at aer feet and thinks ae has killed aer **

1291c.description: A’s estate has been in aer family for hundreds of years and it is an unwritten law of the family that it is to be held intact * A commits a transgression when ae sells a piece of woodland, part of an inherited estate **

1293a.description: B forges the name of aer father, F-B, to a note in order to secure money for a certain purpose * B forges the name of aer father, F-B, to a note. Unknown to B, F-B dies suddenly before the date of the note **

1293b.description: B secretly borrows on property ae is holding in trust in order to forward a certain enterprise

1293c.description: B, in order to carry out a certain enterprise, sells a valuable heirloom, X, confided to aer for safe-keeping by A

1309a.description: B, seeking to protect aerself from A, shoots and kills aer

description: B’s friend, A-3, mysteriously disappears

1313a.description: A seeks revenge upon aer friend, A-2 * A and aer friend, A-2, are of high and honored station: and A, seeking revenge against A-2, must conceal aer purpose and proceed by mdirection **

1313b.description: A, supposed to be dead, plays the role of a ghost * A, supposed dead, plays the role of ghost and, as a method of reprisal, haunts aer enemy, A-3 **

1319a.description: A, in order to be revenged upon aer enemy, A-3, manufactures an infernal machine, X * A sends an infernal machine, X, to aer enemy, A-3, and it falls into the hands of A’s friend, A-2 **

1319b.description: A constructs a deadly trap in a place where, ae thinks, aer enemy, A-3, will fall into it * A sets a trap for A-3, but A-2 is caught in it **

1323a.description: A, seeking revenge against B-3 for a wrong committed by aer spouse, A-3, who is dead, finds that B-3 treasures A-3’s memory most sacredly, unaware of aer evil character * A could destroy the beautiful love and devotion of B-3, for aer dead spouse, A-3, by telling aer the sort of man A-3 was ** A, in a spiritual victory, decides to forego a cherished enterprise and spare an innocent woman aer happy but mistaken ideals ***

1323b.description: A, prosperous and successful, is hated by a rival, A-3 * A is brought under suspicion as a political conspirator through the craftiness of a rival, A-3 **

1324a.description: A’s enemy, A-3, craftily seeks to encompass the death of A * A, by subtle enterprise, brings upon A-3 the fate A-3 was seeking to bring upon aer **

1324b.description: A is sent abroad with a companion, A-3. A-3 bears a letter to a clique of powerful conspirators, A-5, A-5, A-5, ordering the death of A * A secretly examines a letter in the possession of A-3, aer traveling companion, and discovers that the letter is aer own death warrant. A carefully erases aer own name and fills in the name of A-3 **

1333a.description: A, a chemist, with the use of subtle poisons, develops a flower of unusual color and beauty * A gives B, who loves flowers, some of aer rare blooms—with unhappy results **

1333b.description: A, with a hobby for collecting curios, presents B with an old, hand painted miniature * The miniature of a beautiful woman, framed in gold, containing a mechanism by which a needle, steeped in poison, is thrown out of the painted face. The minature to be worn “next the heart” **

1334a.description: A is haunted by a delusion that arouses superstitious fear and causes aer to give up an enterprise

1334b.description: A’s friend, A-2, is killed in an accident at A’s side * A, superstitious, believes ae is haunted by the ghost of aer friend, A-2 **

1334c.description: A’s friend, A-2, is mysteriously murdered * A seeks to discover the murderer of aer friend, A-2 **

1342b.description: A supposes ae has murdered A-3; then, suddenly, A-3 appears before aer

1348a.description: A’s mortal pride would transgress the Divine Power; so fate, seeking to discipline A, materializes a spirit, AX, in A’s image * A’s property and high place in the world are appropriated by AX, and when A would claim aer earthly possessions, ae is treated as an imposter **

1348b.description: A invents a mechanical giant, AX, and endows it with life * A, inventing a mechanical giant, AX, and endowing it with life, is pursued by AX and brought to aer death **

description: A discovers a magic method for realizing all aer wishes

1361a.description: A, in a dream, sees a person ae hates, A-3, in aer room * A has an evil dream which haunts aer waking moments, works on aer mind and has its effect on aer behavior **

1361b.description: A is sure that an occult experience ae has had portends success in a certain enterprise * A is so sure of success in an enterprise that ae puts forth no effort to win; and the enterprise fails **

1364a.description: B receives in a mysterious manner a photograph, not of aerself but of some one greatly resembling aer * B receives a photograph; and on the back of it is written: “You are in great danger! Beware!” **

1364b.description: B finds a note, ostensibly written by A, which causes B great perturbation * B’s friend, B-2, perpetrates a hoax by forging a note which has to do with B and A **

1367a.description: A, annoyed by a certain object, X, destroys it * A destroys a certain object, X, but mysteriously it reappears; again and again A destroys X, but always it reappears **

1367b.description: A has invented a life preserver for the use of shipwrecked persons * A, in order to prove the value of a life preserver ae has invented, dons the rubber suit, inflates it and secretly, by night, drops overboard from a steamer on the high seas **

1370a.description: A’s friend, A-2, is in the dark regarding an important secret that surrounds X, an object of mystery that has been stolen from aer * A knows the secret of X, an object of mystery stolen from A-2, and seeks ,to use aer knowledge in recovering X **

1370b.description: A, a Fortyniner, returning with a wagon train from California, has with aer a fortune in gold dust * A and aer companions are attacked by Indians, A’s companions are killed and A is mortally wounded ** A, alone and near death, buries aer store of gold dust and draws a map of the cache on a water canteen, X ***

1370c.description: A, discovering a “pocket” of gold in the desert, dies before ae can take out the gold * A, near death, draws a cryptic map on the page of a note book, locating the spot where a store of gold may be found **

1372b.description: A, as a method of reprisal against aer native land, turns traitor in time of war and joins the forces of the enemy
